Reviews.Title: “Solid 3* BW with a few nice extras”
Reviews.Author: usuallyhappytravels
Reviews.Content: This Bestwestern is on Hotel Circle, the bargain hotel area of SD. Despite its marine themed name, this is not close to the ocean, but the property has a nice heated pool as well as two hot tubs (one open 24h, the other closes at 10. like the pool). The landscaping is tropical, and pleasant, rooms were clean, two stories throughout, but may have to walk some distance from the lobby to get there. Breakfast was not included in the very reasonable rate, 2 Queen beds, with mirrored wall, good office chair and desk, decent Wifi. There was a public MTS bus from Old Town, stop is directly in front of the hotel. The airport shuttle operates every hour on the hour, a nice bonus (keep in mind it will take ~15 minutes to get to your terminal). Service both at checkin and checkout was much slower than typical for BW, PC with internet had non-working printer in lobby. Would probably stay here again, despite some interstate noise.

Reviews.Title: “Best western Seven Seas? Never again!! Never!!”
Reviews.Author: Isaac K
Reviews.Content: Best western San Diego? Never again!! Never!! One of the worst hotels I ever visit, incredible noise was part of every night The service in Pakistan is better, the workers do not give any respect to clients Timing is not familiar word, they are chronic late Every day we lost 3 H to wait for shuttle Never again!! Never!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong here”
Reviews.Author: Rob N
Reviews.Content: Will definitely stay here again......nice pool and hot tub area (very clean) grounds where like a park........don't believe there was a C/ Breakfast as had to leave at 5AM but good restaurant on site........Main reason would stay again is location for me.....easy on and off I 8 East or West and took only 20 minutes travel to return rental car and be on shuttle to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not too thrilled”
Reviews.Author: Interested01
Reviews.Content: I paid in advance with points, but the clerk swiped my debit card and put an unexpected and extremely unwelcome $108 hold on my checking account. I think $30 would've been reasonable. At first I was glad they upgraded me to a suite, but I ended up with one extra bathroom and a Jacuzzi that didn't fill even after 90 minutes. I eventually gave up on it. I was also gifted with one really long hair stuck to the edge of the tub. The supervisor I talked with was nice, but the manager who replied to my feedback wasn't very responsive. I'm a Platinum member with Best Western Rewards, but I'm pretty sure I'm going to let that membership expire. I've had just too many disappointments at their properties, not that my hopes are ever too high. This property was cleaner than many of the Best Westerns I've stayed in, but there were too many surprises for my taste. For me it's a tarnished brand, even with their relatively new three-tiered structure that makes expectations a little more clear. The location is great. If you like sports bars, the Tilted Kilt is an interesting place to go.

Reviews.Title: “We would DEFINITELY come again! 4.5 out of 5”
Reviews.Author: Tamar A
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip to plan for 45 people. I made one phone call to Toni at the hotel and she arranged EVERYTHING! The rooms were clean, beds had the best mattresses so I finally had a weekend with terrific sleep. The grounds feel more like a Club Med than a hotel as it is lush with greenery and pools and walkways. Gym equipment is great, pools are perfect. The onsite bar is terrific but restaurant is a bit kitchy. However the food is good. The building is a bit older but don't let the looks fool you. This is a hotel with great service, great grounds, and a 2-minute walk to the convention center and everything else. I am going to come again, this time with the husband and kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: derrill
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty average but nice Best Western. The location is fantastic for families and those needing food, mall shopping, coffee, and gasoline close by. You can get most of what you need during your travels close by on Hotel Circle. I have to agree with Nightro below: I booked this as a 3 star "hotel" on Hotwire and got a 2 star motel or motor inn. Beds were double. All the rooms I saw were outside entry and only stairs to the second level that led to an outside corridor. But overall it was average for my expectations of a Best Western; nothing was particularly outstanding. Parking can be difficult if you arrive late. The best part was one of their two hot tubs are open 24 hours, which I appreciated after a late arrival at night. I would go back again if the price stood out, but I think its much like many of the properties on Hotel Circle. Bottom line: Great location, average inn for the area, good but not outstanding, 24 hour hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dos1
Reviews.Content: We took our son and daughter to Disneyland, California Adventure Park, San Diego Zoo and the USS Midway. We spent two evenings in Anaheim and two evenings in San Diego. This hotel was 10x better than the hotel in Anaheim. The location was perfect and their shuttle dropped us off at the San Diego Zoo and the USS Midway. We drove from Albuquerque, NM and we definately did not want to navigate the San Diego streets after spending hours on California freeways. Great service and great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: goanywheretogether
Reviews.Content: Great location. The staff was very friendly and the room was clean. The traffic noise didn't bother me but for 2 nights I think we were in between some kind of mens sports team and it was pretty loud. It was a little too cold for us to use the pool even though it's heated but it looked clean and nice. For the price we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for your money”
Reviews.Author: Kyle P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights over the weekend. It's a great stay for your money. The rooms were average hot water was plentiful, the beds were extra comfortable, the food was ehhh not worth the money but the wait staff was friendly. I liked the way it was tucked back into the corner you were not able to hear the freeway noise at night when you slept. I would stay here again and for $59.00 a night you can't beat it. Its only 10 min away from mission beach and other great beaches and things to do. I felt safe and comfortable here and I WOULD recommend it to anyone, just do not expect a luxury suite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: alanadi25
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Seven Seas whilst visiting San Diego. I booked on Hotwire and got a great price. Check in was easy and quick and we went to our room to find two very small double beds (they were probably king singles). It would have been nice for the front desk staff to ask if I preceded two beds or one. My partner and I felt as though we were on school camp. Nonetheless the room was very clean and had been recently upgraded. There was a good selection of tv channels too. I needed to send a fax and was charged $6 for a 5 page fax, that the receiver only got one and a half pages of. I thought that was very steep, but just paid it because I needed to send it. At 8:10am on our second morning we awoke to the maid opening our door, it was very annoying. We put up the do not disturb sign on our last night but we were still disturbed by the maid knocking on and opening everyone else's doors. The stay was ok, I probably would stay again because the location is very good. Just put up your do not disturb sign if you want to sleep in past 8am!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent motel choice for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: brinaim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in January while attending a confrence. I must say I was really impressed with the level of service the property offered from the moment I step foot on the airport shuttle. The driver was very nice, as were the folks at the check-in desk. The room itself had recently been renovated, and was comfortable, complete with newer bedding, and fixtures within. We were on a bottom-level room, and did hear some noise from the people above, but it wasn't anything that I found to be annyoing. They offer wi-fi (free) in the rooms, and there is one computer in the lobby for printing boarding passes. They also will let you check your luggage there if your room isn't ready yet so you can go out and explore the San Diego area. The grounds are simply beautiful, there's really no other way to describe them. Lots of trees and grass about, and a really nice looking pool & spa area (didn't use either of them). Lastly, the food in the restaurant was a bit pricey, but of good quality, especially since there doesn't seem to be much else other than hotels in this area. They do have a little bar there too. If my travels take me into San Diego again for either business of pleasure, I wouldn't hesitate in booking this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chath65
Reviews.Content: Spent seven days in January and had a excellent stay. The staff was courteous and helpful plus the room was clean exactly as I liked. The exercise center could probably use a little more equipment but it was ok. Didn't use the pool although it was clean because the weather was a little cool and rainy. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: flyermontana
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was a pleasant surprise. Although I didn't have time to take advantage of any of these nice facilities, the pool looked large, clean and inviting, and there was a hot tub. Nice cafe/restaurant on the premises, and very helpful staff and airport shuttle service (doesn't begin till 6 am though, and ends at 10 pm.) My bed was extremely comfortable with plenty of nice big pillows, and the wifi worked well. Good water pressure, mini fridge in room but no microwave. A very quiet and restful and comfortable place to spend a night or two--I'd definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: laurelboo
Reviews.Content: This Best Western does not give itself the rating of Premier, but we do. It was very nice. Our bed was comfortable. Our room was neat, clean, and newly decorated. The grounds were nicely landscaped with tropical plants and flowers. We liked the location close to many of the attractions we came to see. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy”
Reviews.Author: DitzyDC
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel recently for three nights and found the place more than adequate. It was clean, the room had been refurbished not too long ago and the front desk, while not especially friendly, was quick and efficient. Being an older property the grounds had a lot more character with landscaping and flowers than newer hotels in the area. It is very conveniently located almost parallel to interstate 8. I didn't need many "services" for this trip so this "nothing fancy" hotel worked great. The only negatives, for me, is that there wasn't a microwave in the room (I like popcorn) and the TV was old, not the nice flat screen type that you can find in many moderately priced hotels these days. Another concern, even though I did not experience it, is the walls seem a little thin and sound travels easily. Everyone there while I was there was quiet so this was not an issue. I'd definitely stay again, although I'd try to time it when there are not many kids or partying folks around.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Shari Z
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this place! My family and I spent a week here and would come back again anytime! The rooms were clean and the housekeeping staff was courteous and efficient. Front desk staff and shuttle drivers were friendly and helpful. The restaurant staff was excellent and our meals were prompt and delicious (they even reminded us about a discount coupon we were entitled to use)! The landscaping was gorgeous!! And we loved that there were two hot tubs (one more private while the other was next to the pool). The beds and pillows were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, lush grounds for expressway-side hotel”
Reviews.Author: gardengatebnb
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing I have to say is that I hardly slept during my 6 nights, but that's only because the nice bed was very firm and pillows were very cushy, the opposite of how I prefer to sleep. But other than this preference item, this place was awesome. I'm convinced I had the very best room, with a gorgeous view of palm trees and desert landscaping and pretty green lawn, as well as quiet and peaceful. It has been a joy to sit here by the window and do computer work I had to do a couple hours a day, between going to beaches and touring. The housekeeping has been very good and more than I've needed, and all staff have been very pleasant. I'm amazed that I could stay here in winter for about $55/night--it has made a fabulous getaway from -13 back home.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: mr-rickson
Reviews.Content: Renovated room, immaculately clean, chairs desks, rugs, and furniture are all new. Based on some sketchy reviews, I was a bit worried, but this place was an excellent choice. So much nicer than some basic rooms at other motels even though in winter rooms can be had for $55. Most everyone I spoke with who was staying here was very pleased. Staff are helpful and professional. Unless you are desperate, avoid the restaurant. Coffee is good, but breakfast was greasy and just not worth the money. Its edible, just pretty lousy.

Reviews.Title: “If you actually want to sleep, look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: tammy m
Reviews.Content: The room and hotel itself were decent enough BUT it is ridiculous how thin the walls are. You can hear everybody walking upstairs, showers/sinks going, people walking outside, every little noise is heard and if you want to actually sleep at all I would not recommend staying here. We were woken up constantly by people upstairs and by the ridiculously loud water heater which sounded like it was in the wall right next to our bed squeaking and running extremely loud!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Valleyblue
Reviews.Content: For the price paid, the Seven Seas is a good value. Our room was toward the back and on the second floor, so we didn't experience a lot of highway noise. The room was very clean, but could use some minor maintenance, there's some rust around the bathroom fixtures, loose doorknobs, the security latch needs replacement, etc. Overall, the room was adequate, small but certainly serviceable. The biggest complaint was that the room was cold and the heater was of little value. We had to ask for an additional blanket, which they provided. Our request to the maid for a blanket, went unheeded so we had to call down to the front desk when we returned that night. The response was "we'll see if we have any extras." A maintenance person came by shortly to deliver the "extra sheets we requested." He seemed surprised when I told him that we needed a blanket, not sheets. Who needs extra sheets? He finally return a few minutes later with a blanket. The on site restaurant is so-so. The food is OK, but a bit pricey for what you get but the service was very friendly and attentive. Prior to booking, we were concerned by other reviews about unfriendly service and dreadfully slow internet access. Perhaps we were lucky, or the management since responded to feedback, but the front desk staff was very courteous and friendly and the Internet access was amongst the fastest and easiest to connect to that we've had at any hotel. No complaints there at all. The biggest downsides is that the plumbing is very noisy and you can hear water running anytime a nearby room uses water. One advantage of a hotel at Hotel Circle over lodging at the more touristy areas (such as the Gaslamp District in San Diego) is that you are nearby to neighborhood stores such as a CVS pharmacy, Target, Staples along with non-tourist restaurants. This is an advantage if you need toothpaste, another pair of socks, or other incidentals since you can get it without paying the outrageous prices found in hotel gift shops/convenience stores. Also, if you just want to grab a quick bite to eat without the high price of vacation spots. This is a big advantage if you are traveling on business. It is only a few minutes drive to Old Town, the Gaslamp District, Balboa Park, and other attractions. We chose this hotel because of price, and we would stay again. We use hotels for sleeping, changing, and showering. If you're looking for a place to stay where you'll be hanging out, using a gym, and a spa; this probably isn't the place for you (although the pool and jacuzzi looked inviting); but if you want a lower price place that's convenient and clean, this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for your Buck in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: BobbyCha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days in November. All three rooms were nothing less than spectacular. Our rate was awesome through PRICELINE and was under 40.00. The facilities are spotless and the location is super... the crossroads of San Diego... two malls just 2 miles away, great cuisine up the hill and access to the pool and whirlpools were also great. Free parking and everyone we encountered was very nice. We'd pay a little more to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bare Bones Basic”
Reviews.Author: hummergirlTempe_Az
Reviews.Content: This is an older property. The rooms could use an update. Loud plumbing noises. Paper thin walls. Sketchy people staying there. The good news? Nice hot tub, great task chair, wonderful bed, perfect location, nice staff, fridge in room. All in all, you get what you pay for, and for what it cost, it was pretty much what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property - Well worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen K
Reviews.Content: We attended the San Diego Thanksgiving Dixieland Jazz Festival that is held at the Town & Country each year - this hotel was an easy walk to the site each day. Other restaurants and activities are very accessible by foot, trolly or the hotel shuttle. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. One of the drivers, David, was especially friendly and was very informative about the area and attractions. When we arrived I was concerned about freeway noise as the property has the freeway running on 2 sides. We stayed in building 2, and requested the 2nd floor - with the widows open you could just hear the freeway noise, but with everything closed, it was very quiet - we didn't even hear our neighbors and they had a 2 year old in the room! We had a single Queen room - the decorations were up-to-date and the room was clean and very comfortable. It was nice to have a refrigerator for drinks and leftovers, but there is no microwave to use so we were careful to keep only that which we would eat cold. The housekeeping staff was very helpful. They provided an extra blanket when requested and folded it nicely on the bed when the room was made-up each day. The hotel restaurant offers breakfast, lunch and dinner. We did not eat breakfast there as 2 blocks to the west is the "Family Restaurant" where the breakfast was a lot less expensive ($7.99) for a larger meal. We did eat dinner on site, however, the first night we ordered the Tri-tip meal - the meat was awful - over cooked, chewy and tough. After 1 slice we did not finish the meal and the waiter never asked why - I was reluctant to return, but my husband said we should try again - the remainder of the meals were acceptable to good in quality and quantity. A FEW IMPORTANT NOTES: The hotel places a $75.00 "hold" charge on your credit card when you check in for "incidental charges". This is refunded when you check out. I am finding this practice more common lately, especially if you book through a travel site instead of through the hotel. You will receive a 15% off lunch or dinner coupon when you check in but it can only be used 1 time - however, if you ask at the front desk prior to each meal they will provide you with another one. Overall, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: cgm95
Reviews.Content: We picked this location because it was near the home of some friends we were seeing in San Diego. Driving to the hotel is a little tricky as it is on "hotel circle" right next to the freeway and there were lots of little side turns to navigate. Once there, though, the front desk staff were accommodating and checked us right in. They informed us their wireless was not working, but we had no trouble logging in from the room. Our room was on the top floor with an outside entrance (not in a hallway) so there was considerable noise from people in the parking lot, coming up the stairs and walking to rooms. Not horrible, but something to consider. After settling in we walked around part of the hotel circle. There are restaurants nearby and other things to do in and around the other hotels, but there is a lot of traffic driving by. Sleeping was generally okeh, except for the noise from the parking lot. Otherwise, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “$75.00 even when paying with credit card”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: I am questioning the managers response in the below post. I had to pay a $75 deposit and I payed with a credit card. I stayed there 5 days ago and I am still getting crazy charges from this hotel. Very irritating Room was small and dirty. Hot water was non-existent. Cable was snowy with few channels. Ate at restaurant and got heartburn. The Internet was dropping constantly. Bed was not very comfortable. Would not recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A party hotel not of the best kind”
Reviews.Author: linda l
Reviews.Content: The first hint about the parties was paying a $75 deposit on check in against damage to the room. Should have ran then. The rooms are VERY small, the beds are very uncomfortable. The party took place in the parking lot all night. I did not feel safe and slept very little as we were worried about our car and luggage in the parking lot. Would never stay there again and would never recommend this hotel/motel to anyone. Hotel staff at check in unfriendly, we are retirees not party people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but watch out”
Reviews.Author: Dennis B
Reviews.Content: We stay for one night. The room was clean and up to par.The bed was comfortable,bathroom was clean. The only trouble I had was that they charge a $75 refundable fee for the room.This in case of smoking or other damages to the room. Also the parking lot is small. It was hard to get a spot in front of your room. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Simon L
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. The rooms were nice and clean. And the hot tub and swimming pool were lovely. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: mgparkvold
Reviews.Content: The following events that I describe are completely true!!! I have stayed at many hotels and honestly I have never had a complaint. My boyfriend and I stayed at the Best Western Seven Seas hotel recently in San Diego, California. I had paid $100 for a night and looked at the pictures and it seemed like a nice hotel that was in a good location. We we got there were completely shocked of how dirty the room was and how unsafe we felt. The door to our room had a 1 inch gap all the way around it so we could hear everything that was going on outside (this was like a motel not a hotel, you had to access rooms from outside). The sheets on the bed were scratchy and when you walked on the floor you could feel hair on your feet. The water never heated up when I took a shower and the towels gave me a rash. BUT it gets better.... At about 2:30 am someone began banging on our hotel door and you could hear the clacking of high heels outside. Somebody was walking back and floor and knocking on everyone's door and was screaming. Keep in mind that our door had a 1 inch gap all the way around it so we could hear EVERYTHING. My boyfriend finally woke up and answered the door. When he opened the door, a hooker was standing outside saying that she had lost the key to room and didn't know which one it was. Then she asked if she could stay in our room and of course we shut and locked the door. In the morning we left as fast as we could. I would never recommend anyone staying here EVER. I am not a picky person by any means and I was disgusted out of my mind. If you want to stay in San Diego and not pay an arm and leg for a hotel just pay $20-$50 extra a night to stay at a Marriott or a Holiday Inn Express. Those hotel chains have a higher quality of everything. But please don't stay here. You will regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pack your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: LEKCabarete
Reviews.Content: Well, we had perhaps the worst night in a hotel that we've had during our 1 night stay before catching our early morning flight. The main issue was the noise. There was highway noise (which is normal for hotels) and party and "other" noises. Perhaps we were just unlucky, but the walls are THIN - hence the title of this review. Pack your earplugs. We did not bother to call the front desk to report the party people, we've been the ones having fun plenty of other times, so we do understand, but it was pretty sleepless. There was only 1 bath towel. The gal at check in was really nice, she booked us a taxi after we received the bad news that the shuttle only started at 6am (the first flights out of San Diego are at 6am) Attn: Hotel Management - start your shuttle earlier! The taxi price was quoted as being the flat rate of $21, however the delightfully helpful and cheerful taxi driver told us no, it's $27. Are taxi drivers really that bad the world over?! So irritating! Many of these issues are either not the hotels fault or fixable with a pestering front desk, but who really wants to mess around with that when they are just trying to get some rest? Would not go back, and would not recommend it. Sorry!

Reviews.Title: “BEST WESTERN SEVEN SEAS”
Reviews.Author: petesman
Reviews.Content: this hotel is by the interstate....but l could not hear it..its near to atractions as in sea world,,,,staff was good in the reception...if you dont have a car it could be awkward to drag caes to your room!.....rooms are not real big..but are clean...beds was good..outside doors!,stayed twice and found ist floor rooms noisy...stayed again went on 2nd floor...was much better...but no elevator to 2nd floor!.....no breackfast ,,but you can use a place tied to the hotel for food!.....the area is quiet busy..but not really a prob....airport shuttle free....first one at 6am..last l think was 9 pm.....l would use. again...booked thou booking com....weekday 59$......weekend 65$..plus the dreaded tax....but a fair price for a city....pool looked good....was never full..which is always a good sign......from the harbor only ten mins....downtown about the same..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok ...but customer service is the WORST !”
Reviews.Author: bev l
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok.......no matter if the place is totally empty -- this witch at the front desk Ashley WILL NOT let you have your room keys until after 3pm....im ok with that ----but it is BAD Customer Service when rooms are clean and ready and empty (parking lot empty on a MOnday) and they still make you wait !!! I have stayed here twice and the manager on the desk (or she calls herself the manager) Ashley is one of the most rudest individuals I have ever checked in with. She goes out of her way to be UNFRIENDLY ! She needs an attitude adjustment or get out of the customer service hotel industry if she is that miserable working with the public I would of NEVER came back to this place because of her --- but only did because I went through HOTWIRE and you never know what your going to get ! Not worth the stay having to deal with such miserable check-in hotel staff !!

Reviews.Title: “Boo!”
Reviews.Author: billie m
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. Stayed one night. The TV remote didn't work with TV. Replacement didn't work (3rd one did). Then TV didn't work (but the 2nd one did). Then there was no hot water. Then the internet went out. This is the first time I've ever given my key to a hotel maintenance person and told them to just knock before coming in while I was in bed?!?! That lasted 5 hours! Staff were nice people...but being a nice person doesn't equal good customer service. They didn't know how to troubleshoot the problems, didn't communicate with one another about the problems and never offered any compensation for all the drama! I paid more for this room than the other places I stayed in San Diego. I expected more from best western. Promise to never return.

Reviews.Title: “fun in the sun!”
Reviews.Author: tmanfewell
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Seven Seas is a great place to stay in San Diego. There is a nice pool and spa. My son likes that there is a restaurant on the property and room service. This hotel is conveniently looked to all the sites of San Diego and a great shopping center!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but showing age”
Reviews.Author: fox_and_spouse
Reviews.Content: Picked because of location and grounds. Both were excellent choices, however the rooms were showing their age. They werre clean but needed a little paint in closet etc. Still we enjoyed the 5 days and the room was very well priced. Excellent maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Redlyn522
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here three nights while attending a convention. The room size was adequate and clean and the bed was fairly comfortable. No microwave and there was only one plug-in that had to serve the mini-fridge, hair dryer, and coffee maker so you had to unplug one to use another which was inconvenient. We had a ground floor room and at 6:45 a.m. the people upstairs took a shower and our plumbing sounded like a jack hammer. There are no restaurants nearby except for the one in the hotel and it is very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lckynmber20
Reviews.Content: This place was a nightmare. We got in super late and the night vlerk was great the trouble started the next morning when I woke up to a dead bed bugs under my neck and a baby one crwaling around on the sheets. The housekeeper confirmed that it was a bed bug. They moved us rooms but only 2 doors down from where we originally were so we had to ask again to be moved to a completely different part of the hotel. The operations manager came to our room to make sure everything was ok and said that he would pay for our drycleaning then when we asked about him paying for it again he said no that it would be to expensive to have everything dry cleaned. He said they had checked the room and didnt find anything, however they did not check it thoroughly and the "check" was over in about an hour, where as a real check should take all day. They only comped half of our first night stay and teh front desk girl was a nightmare to deal with. Do Not stay here it is not worth the money or teh headache!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Looey
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at a Best Western because they are decent hotels with great customer service. This hotel was a BIG disappointment. The room was adequate at best. When our door wouldn't lock when shut from the outside, the repairman was there in 15 min. or less and repaired the locking mechanism. My problem was with the so-called 'shuttle service'. When my husband called for a pick-up we were told where the van would stop and when we should be at the pick-up location. After waiting for nearly an hour and no van we took a cab back to the hotel. When we asked about the missed connection we were told we hadn't signed up for a pick-up earlier in the day and the driver had something else to do. Why weren't we told this when my husband called and asked about getting a ride? The next incident with the shuttle came while waiting at SeaWorld. We got an independent ride to SeaWorld and thought we'd get the same ride back, but changed our minds. So, we had not signed up for the return trip. My husband called and asked the receptionist if there was a van scheduled for pick-up at SeaWorld since we had not signed up earlier for a return ride to the hotel. The receptionist said that there would be a pick-up at 5:30 and we should be there at least 10 min. early (my husband called at 3 p.m.). We arrived at the pick-up spot 15 min. early and waited about 30 min. before calling the hotel and asking if we had been waiting in the wrong place. The receptionist said the van should have been there but since it wasn't she checked and found out that the driver had not left and had no plans to drive out to get us. Evidently because we had not signed up in the morning for the van, and even though the driver had nothing else to do, we were left waiting for nothing and ended up taking a cab. This was not an isolated incident. In talking to another hotel guest, when she made her motel reservation, she was promised shuttle service to a special event, but was later told the shuttle did not serve the location she needed to go. We understood that their priority is shuttling people to and from the airport, but it seems the receptionist wasn't smart enough to add our name to 'the list'. One hand doesn't seem to know what the other is doing. I will definitely not recommend that anyone stay at this hotel. However, the restaurant adjacent to the hotel has good food and service that is outstanding. The big San Diego Blackout happened on our first day at this motel. Senad Kolenovic, the Food & Beverage Supervisor, welcomed us like family: gave us a table by the window where there was light; he served us ice water, bar snacks, and cold sandwiches. So, stay somewhere else but eat here.

Reviews.Title: “maybe the worst hotel in the country..”
Reviews.Author: brad f
Reviews.Content: I've seen hundreds of hotels in my day and this one was a certifiable abomination. It was a cesspool of filth and bed bugs with small rooms and pillows flatter than most boards. The sheets/comforter had holes in them and smelled disgusting. I wouldn't stay there again if you paid me. Do you know how long it takes for bed bug bites to heal? It takes about 2 weeks. This place should be burned down and built anew, it's THAT BAD!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Hotel but Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dahlsk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business convention in a tight double room. Nothing fancy but clean. There is a pool so that's nice and location is a not bad walk to the tram system. Wouldn't make a point of choosing to stay there again but was fine for a convention trip.

Reviews.Title: “good at times”
Reviews.Author: Tammy j
Reviews.Content: booked 4 days online first 3 were ok but 4th we did not feel comfortable going to the pool as they booked a private party that took up the whole pool and spa area.feeling cheated.most of the staff was pleasent but the shuttle person leaves something to be desired.Very rude and unfriendly.room clean and good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: vegastosd
Reviews.Content: Easy access to the Zoo, Wild Safari Park, Seaport village, Old Town. Room was clean and we asked for a "quiet room" in the back away from the screaming children at the pool - and slept great with no distraction noise :) Prices are very reasonable and if you join the Best Western Rewards club, you can earn free nights.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you think you'll get based on price..in a Good Way”
Reviews.Author: s7km4
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. This hotel is exactly what you would expect based on the price. The Good = great location that is within 10 minutes to all (zoo, seaworld, petco, jolla, beaches), nice pool and hot tub area, ample parking spots (just not after 12 as expected), and reasonable price. The Bad = not the most plush bed but exactly what I expected. If you're looking for location + price, this is the place for you

Reviews.Title: “this place sucks sometimes”
Reviews.Author: lovetodive355
Reviews.Content: You can tell a lot about a place by the smell...this place stinks. The smell of mildew and stale air makes you want to turn around. Our toilet sounded like a rocket ship. My family and I were horrified but toughed out the trip because my wife was attending a conference and someone at her work booked this place. My son got a couple of bug bites. We left vowing never to come back. Unfortunately, my friends booked a weekend in San Diego the following weekend and I never asked about the place. To my dismay, I was once again back at the Best Western Seven Seas. The room in the 400 wing smelled so much better than the ones in the 200 wings. The toilet didn't shake and nobody was bitten by bugs. Maybe the 200 wing just sucks...the location of this place is great though, as it is by everything. If I somehow go back to hotel row again, I will not take a chance on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, overall solid value”
Reviews.Author: Spinefx1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Best Western Seven Seas on Family trip. Location is great for the beach. This section of the beach is "lively" day and night. Hotel was quiet and safe. Rooms well maintained. Laundry available. Walk up and down boardwalk. Great restaurant next door. Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Bare-Bones Hotel with worse-than-dial-up internet”
Reviews.Author: Gerintell
Reviews.Content: I want to start this review by saying the room was clean and acceptable in that regard. Unfortunately these are the reasons I rated this hotel "poor" despite the above: <> The water in the shower was a roller coaster of hot and cold as our neighbors around us flushed their toilets. <> The internet was the worst I have ever seen, it literally would not load basic web pages in under a half a minute and we had full signal. Netflix did not even remotely work, nor did google in any timely manner - my phone provided our internet, which I have to pay for separately. <> The room was absolutely tiny, it barely fit a queen sized bed and two chairs. It was, however, clean and nice for what it was. <> There was a refrigerator, but it was not turned on... so by the time it was cold we no longer had any use for it. <> There were less toiletry items than a mid-level motel - 2 soaps and 1 very small shampoo, both low quality. <> There were only two towels and two pillows, the bare essentials. They knew there were two of us a week before checking in. After a trip to the pool our towels had a layer of chlorine on them, which we continued to use the next morning unfortunately as that was our only option. <> The faucets are extremely loud - we could hear every single one of our neighbors washing their hands at odd hours of the night and morning. <> As I write this review (on my phone's internet) I also hear a vacuum next door (through the door that separates our room from the next) - It is 8:20 in the morning on a Saturday. So overall this is a great place for around 50-70 dollars (winter/summer) but we paid a premium of $120 for this room and we were quite disappointed at what that 120 dollars purchased us.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, interesting workers.”
Reviews.Author: LeftyDv
Reviews.Content: The hotel was within walking distance of a three-day conference at the beginning of August. The hotel looked really nice, but upon arrival things got sketchy. The rooms were tiny; the three guests I stayed with literally bounced into one another because there was so little floor space. You can tell people spend their time in San Diego away from their hotels. The pool area was nice and the happy hour specials at the bar were very cheap. (1.25 per draft beer or house well). The staff was not very friendly. They did nice things like keep bags locked and provided directions, but for the most part they seemed disgruntled and annoyed at their business. On a side note, the hotel made a mistake and had us checking out a day early. So at 11:30 at night, we were "greeted" by people thinking they were walking into their room. Then, we were waken again by a rude security man knocking on our door like he was about to enter with a no-knock warrant. When we tried to call the front desk to find out what was going on, the phone was broken, as the cord was damaged behind the nightstand. Ultimately, our company was comped for the night but the manager (Steve) who was very apologetic. However, the experience was quite alarming, nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hotel with cleen rooms”
Reviews.Author: PinoGeppi
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in San Diego on our roadtrip. The Best Western is nice, cleen, there was a huge room with two queen size beds. There was free wifi and a refrigerator. We had a quite room on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff is one of the BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: dfarrell2
Reviews.Content: You have a wonderful hotel staff. Everyone I encountered greeted me with courtesy and a smile. I especially loved your cafe. Your staff was absolutely wonderful every time I came in. Each one had a happy, contagious personality. What a wonderful way to start and end my day. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped Noisy Rooms, Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: apex4040
Reviews.Content: Very uncomfortable stay. Double beds which are way too small for two people have been squeezed in a very small room with just a few inches left around them. Almost no sound proofing in walls or the window which is literally 6 inches from your sleeping head. You hear every inconsiderate person walking by, and every car starting or parking only 4 feet from the window. AC is loud and doesn't work right so you have to leave the window open which makes it even noisier and more unsafe. The toilet flush sounds like an F16 preparing to take off and you can here same noise from every neighboring room. Otherwise, it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: cookedintucson
Reviews.Content: Very nice older hotel on " hotel circle" with mature tropical landscaping . Location is within minutes of the major attractions . Small but very nice room . A nice cafe on the property with outdoor patio seating that was great for breakfast . What made this hotel get an excellent rating was the value . Got a internet special rate that was way below their normal rate ( july- Aug is high season ) and at least a third less than the other comparable hotels .

Reviews.Title: “Wow just wow”
Reviews.Author: rewerts85
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to say this was a good trip but not because of the MOTEL. We went to sea world, koby's swap meet and did a lot of shopping. The Hotel has around 200 rooms, one pool, two hot tubs and a small restaurant on site. Some of the rooms come with microwaves, fridges and other necessities. Sadly when I arrived at 3 they didn't have any rooms available for check in. We had to wait for half in hour but I didnt mind because we went out to eat and came back. We walk into our room which was right next to the pool and once we walk in the room had an old big fashion TV with a small fridge and no microwave. I asked about the microwave but all of those rooms were booked even though I booked my room 3 days in advance. The small thing I didn't mind but I did mind when the bath room door would not shut closed and the bed was rock hard. Also the internet they provide is WIRELESS B which is one of the slowest connections possible. I couldn't stream any thing on my laptop and at midnight my wife woke me up because she was hearing a LADY SCREAMING TO DEATH!! I call room service and they said they will send some one to check it out but another twenty minutes passed and the screams came again. Then after another phone call to the front desk we finally got some one to check it out and it was the couple next door fighting and throwing stuff at each other. The worst part was the front desk calls me two hours later to tell me they checked out the problem. This was at TWO in the MORNING!!! I would not recommend this hotel to any one. If you can spear the TEN BUCKS do it. I learned the hard way and went cheap and suffered the worst sleep that day. The only good thing was my daughter loved the warm pool that doesnt close until 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “What does Seven Seas mean?!”
Reviews.Author: mistermark8
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for some business clients from Europe and this hotel was nice at first from pictures, and upon arrival the hotel rooms, lobby, and restaurant are sore to look at. This hotel needs an upgrade in all aspects. Best Western is known for the quality all over the world and adding Seven Seas to this name, makes it seem like it's a more high quality brand of Best Western. Unfortunately, the Seven Seas brand looks like a take on a low-end Motel. The beds were uncomfortable, the bathrooms were tiny, the televisions were old, and the restaurant had bad service and over charges for coffee. The lobby is not grand and seems very plain with no decor or welcoming atmosphere. Please do something about this Best Western, you can do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Would not come back”
Reviews.Author: pajamie
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is in a decent location the rooms are outdated, small and not the cleanest. There are plenty of others to choose from in hotel circle for similar prices. Some reviewers talked about a renovation but I can say that the building in the way back was definitely not renovated. We had a room with two queen beds and it seemed quite small for 2 adults and 2 kids. Personally, I thought the place was pretty gross and would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: flaca21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our last trip to San Diego. I was hoping to get a good value for our money and save at the same time. The hotel is situated in Misson Valley. There are lots of other hotels/motels/inns in the area. We were glad that we rented a car as it would be hard to get around without it. Less than 30 min drive to all the places we wanted to visit. Rooms are clean enough and have most of the necessary amenities. We didn't use pool as it was full of kids all the time and closed early (around 10pm). We used hot tub once and it was fine. What struck us most is their service. On the day of check in we tried to call front desk and ask about latest check in time. We had to call five times to reach any living person there, and even after somebody answered the phone they put me on hold for long five minutes before even asking what I needed to know. The same at the check in - agents kept puting people on hold when they didn't even seem to be busy. We couldn't get much attention from them either. On the second day we requested extra towels and never got them. We ended up asking one of the housekeepers. Overall it wasn't a bad experience, just something different. Our first two nights during the trip we stayed at the Bristol hotel in downtown and the service was excellent. We had a little bit of a shock after arriving to Best Western, but we got what we paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hollowman7717
Reviews.Content: Trust my review when I write this, we stayed at this hotel with friends and I have stayed here in the past about a year ago, well after this trip that just ended I will never go this hotel ever again, first we called them at night tell them we were going to be a little late, and they lady just kept saying "OKAYYYY" and didn't even ask my name, I was just being curteous and letting them know I will be late. then after we got in our room, there was no hot water to take a shower or even wash your hands, there was no trash bags, and the beds are really hard and uncomfortable, this place has really been run down, must be new Management or something, but I will never stay here again, I hope this hotel gets it's act together and improves on the service and quality of Best western I used to know.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Treadaway
Reviews.Content: No problems of any kind. Nice room that was apparently recently decorated; location central to everything; good price; beautiful, tropical landscaping; free wifi that works perfectly. Access to and from the property is a bit challenging on the curve of a busy two-way freeway access road, so look carefully when entering or leaving the parking lot. They have a computer in the front office and let you print out your boarding pass - a huge help that eliminated substantial airport hassles. I was somewhat leery of this place based on reviews I had read, but I would say that there is nothing not to like about it. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place on Hotel Circle”
Reviews.Author: jfong52414
Reviews.Content: This place is on Hotel Circle just before it goes under Hwy 8 and is a short drive to the Zoo and Balboa Park. Our room looked recently remodeled with plenty of space for the two of us. We did not take advantage of any of the facilities(swimming pool). There is a coffee maker and small refrigerator in the room. There is an onsite restaurant though we did not eat there. There appeared to be plenty of parking for guests. The high speed internet was wifi. All in all, I thought it was a nice place. We arrived late on a Friday night and there was a line at check-in. There was only one person at the desk, but she was quite capable and called for help. I would stay there again given the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: angelrowe
Reviews.Content: We were surprised at the hotels resort-like charm when we arrived! Had 2 nights booked and weee disappointed that they were booked up on the Saturday night so we couldn't stay longer!!! Free Internet and free use of the printer in the lobby - brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay on a holiday weekend”
Reviews.Author: poetrypartners
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at plenty of motels and know they can run the gamut from trashy to passable. The Best Western Seven Seas stands out as a motel that gets it right -- clean, comfortable rooms; attractive grounds; friendly staff; easily accessible parking; excellent freeway access and proximity to local attractions; 24-hour hot tub. We'd stayed at the Seven Seas many, many years ago when we were in college, and we opted to stay there over Memorial Day weekend for a trip down memory lane. We were not disappointed and had a most pleasant stay! Check-in was smooth, and the front desk receptionist was very friendly and helpful. Our room, although on the small side, was well-lit and tastefully decorated. We appreciated the in-room coffee (the best I've had at a motel) and the well-stocked basket of soaps and Pantene shampoo, and the shower head was nice and high -- a plus for tall people who don't like to stoop to wet their hair. The bed was a mixed bag. The mattress was decently comfortable, but the pillows were hard and a bit too large, forcing my head to rest at a funky angle. I woke up with a sore neck after the first night; the second and third nights, I used the plush beluga whale I'd gotten at Sea World for a pillow and had better nights' sleep. The pillow was the only problem though. Everything else about the room was quite satisfactory. We also liked the 24-hour hot tub, and the grounds are beautifully landscaped with tropical plants. Even though the motel abuts two freeways, we did not hear any road noise. Generally, the motel was quiet aside from the typical people-passing-the-window sounds you expect at places like this. The Seven Seas is central to Mission Valley, Mission Bay and Sea World, Old Town, and downtown attractions. There are several restaurants within walking distance of the motel, and more restaurants are a quick car ride away in Old Town and at the Fashion Valley Mall. We enjoyed our stay at the Seven Seas and will happily stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: jepoyzia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to find it was our first time in America and we found it straight away. The staff were very friendly on check in. the rooms are fairly small but we had just come from a hotel where we had 2 double beds in the room. It was clean and comfortable so much so I feel asleep about 9pm. We ate in the restaurant there which was really nice again staff there was friendly. The shuttle service is great we used it for both the zoo and sea world, we were even able to use it on the day even though we had checked out of the hotel. There is free internet use on the computer in the lobby which was handy for me. You can walk to the shopping mall where the train service is from but you walk through the backs of hotels and at night it is dark, we had no problems but did walk quickly. Would recommend this hotel to others as for the price was great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, best pool in the area”
Reviews.Author: Aletheo
Reviews.Content: The rooms and restaurant are unexceptional but the service is friendly, the courtyard is lovely and the pool is better than hotels where we've spent quadruple the rate. Worth it just for that.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ericsf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value for San Diego. The hotel is centrally located and offers very good room rates for the area. It's an older motor lodge but has been renovated. Pool and two hot tubs. Rooms very clean and well maintained.Overall it was a good stay and I would stay here again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: reddog6399
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the Best Western 7 Seas for people looking for a clean and affordable hotel. The staff was very helpful. Our family of 4 (2 kids) checked us in before our room was available and kept our luggage while we went to Zoo. A driver took us to the Zoo even though it was past their daily departure (we checked in at 1 pm). The driver made special trip taking only our family there and picking us up. On one evening, I had to go to Best Buy at a nearby mall. The driver offered to drive me and even offered to pick me up after I was done - I even managed to pick up a few grocery items. They even drove people down to Old Town. The driver said priorities destinations are the airport, Amtrak, cruise ship terminals and theme parks....anywhere else is possible is they are not busy. The drivers would like a tip for their service but it was certainly the least one could do. The hotel is siutated just across the highway from a large mall and not far from the Trolley station. Our room was extremely well-kept. It looked newly renovated, clean, and had two double beds. There were free Wifi, fridge and coffee machine available in the rooms and even an internet-equipped computer with printer in the lobby that's free for the hotel patrons to use. The only small drawback is that there aren't a lot of restaurants closeby. We ate at the restaurant at the hotel for breakfasts and dinners and the food was terrific. The kids meals were the size of adult portions and the food was fresh and portions were plentiful. You know that the food is fresh when they serve you delicious home-made salsa with the quesadillas and salads came with fresh slices of avocado. overall, a delightful stay and we would stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Provided a pleasant stay for a pretty good price!”
Reviews.Author: jrsly
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in San Diego wanting to experience something other than Zoo and Sea World. Found the Best Western Seven Seas to be a nice central location to the different sites we planned on visiting. Checking in was smooth, being as I had already paid in advance. However, without asking I was upgraded to one of their suite rooms with no additional cost - this was much appreciated. The room was nice, clean and spacious with two rooms and two bathrooms. Inside the "bedroom" was the smallest "Queen" sized bed I'd seen, but it was still big enough for me (6 ft. tall) and my wife. The bed was pretty hard ... after the second night our bodies were beginning to feel pretty soar. Overall we felt pretty comfortable in the room and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Mzlady09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while we were in San Diego for a wedding. The place was very well kept, the employees were very helpful and friendly, and the price was right on point. They had a very small fitness room, which is only good for a a little cardio, but effective for working out while traveling. There was also a pool and 2 whirlpools. we were right next to the high way which was great since we could get everywhere we needed to go relatively quickly. The seven seas cafe was great for lunch, and they had daily specials. Dinner was kind of expensive and we ended up eating elsewhere. Their breakfst was also a little high so we walked a couple blocks down to this plaza called Mission valley and there was a place that had breakfast for 6.99. The best part about the hotel was the free shuttle thet you can use to get to the airport or other attractions. Its for come first serve so call and let them know what time you need it in advance. I noticed that a lot of reviews complained about poor customer service, and we did not experience that. We got there 3 hours before check in, and the woman at the desk called one of the maids to find out if a room was ready for us. We travel a lot and we have never experienced this before and we thought it was very nice. And even though we had a little mix up with the room, they corrected the problem right away.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Willsalaz
Reviews.Content: The hiotel is clean seems very modern ashame its just the surface. The staff is rude and very unwilling to be helpful. There's no wifi or even in room LAN connections. The pool was dirty and was over chlorinated. I even had a member of the staff tell me to be quiet when I was explain why my wife and I were in the 24 hrs hot tub after 10 pm. Over all from check in to check out it was a horrible experience. An over rated motel is all it is. Thanks for the memories that have been burned into my mind Seven Seas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Howey91
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with compliments: Bed was very comfortable, room was clean and the price was great for the 3 nights were there. But, staff at the front desk never smiled, unhelpful and towels were not brought to our room as requested on two occasions. My husband nicely reported the neglect to the front desk and the person got very defensive insisting theyt were brought there the first time but we weren't there. I was in the room the whole time plus what excuse did they have for the second time? I needed them the same day not the next day. Gee! The blow dryer was broken but was replaced the next morning. Overall, I would recommend for a single or couple if you don't mind a small room and you are on a budget. We had to get directions to a local restaurant from another hotel since ours did not help us. The fridge was a plus. My husband was worried about bed bugs or other critters but we didn't see any insects. The poor customer service was aggravating and they could at least be friendly and smile without the defensive stance.

Reviews.Title: “I'll always come back to the BW7Seas when in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: CommanderTim
Reviews.Content: I realize that I stay at this hotel year after year because of the friendly people that work there. My ever-changing reservations and particular room requests are handled adeptly by Jason. Steve and the entire front desk staff are so friendly; and there is always a 'welcome back" package waiting for me. The head of housekeeping, Rosario always asks me about my room and whether there are any problems. Ruben has my coffee waiting for me on weekday breakfasts and Kim has my order placed before I sit down on the weekends (The usual Dave?). In the bar, Betz, Pam and the incomparable Zack are the life-blood of this place. The restaurant staff Sinod, Harry, Ina, Patrick, etc. always say hello. Even the BBQ chef "Jose Francisco", with his "Philadelphia" attitude, is ready to throw another burger on the grill for me. Because of them, I don't consider staying anyplace else!

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for a nasty surprise!”
Reviews.Author: josta3
Reviews.Content: When you check in, they force you to sign a letter-sized page agreeing to pay several other charges if necessary, all in favor of the hotel, of course. And they also put a charge of $75 on your credit card "just in case". To make it worse, they never pre-warn you about it when you make your reservation because they know you will most likely refuse....they surprise you with it when you check in, knowing that you'll sign it anyways as you're too tired from traveling to walk out and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 345mom
Reviews.Content: The staff acted rudely and the rooms were ridiculously SMALL and crowded. Horrible location!!!! Highways only access blind corner to try to get out on road!! Very dangerous to drive around back of hotel. Beer left everywhere not very family friendly. Pool dangerous to walk to. Ice machines a long hike from any room! Restaurant EXPENSIVE and not impressive. Shuttle drivers appear to be bothered if you ask them to get a ride! Saw a total of 4 people angry at checkout in a period of 2 1/2 days!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!! Not at all interested in your vacation you are nothing but a pain in their butt!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay. Affordable and clean.”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkySoCal
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but it was nice and clean. We were really only there to sleep and soak in the hot tub after a long day of sight seeing. This hotel is close to all the major attractions and restaurants. We'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Some of the best staff anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: ErnieKitchen
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to the area this is without a doubt my hotel of preference. The staff is outstanding, from the house keepers to the front desk. The rooms have recently been redone and are very clean and comfortable. The grounds of the hotel are beautifally kept and adds a tropical feel to the place. And I have never had I meal in the resturant that I did not enjoy. As an added bonus, Zacks bar is a great place to unwind after a busy day. Zack and his fellow bartenders are some of the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “Room smelled like mold!”
Reviews.Author: rdltng
Reviews.Content: This is one of the cheapest Best Westerns in San Diego, so the price is good, but the rooms are dated and it had a strong mold smell. Unacceptable. The area is not in a nice part of SD. It's in hotel circle which is literally just hotels and businesses, not upscale either, more of a seedy area. If you want to stay in SD and near downtown, La Jolla and Coronado are pretty much the only nice areas, and they are very, very nice. Other than that "coastal North County" is the place to stay which is a suburban part of San Diego, about 30min from downtown. If you can't afford La Jolla or Coronado, go for a reputable name motel in Del Mar, Solana Beach, Cardiff, Encinitas, Leucadia, La Costa, or Carlsbad. That's a nice stretch in North County that's within 30 min from everything in SD, plus you'll be that much closer to Orange County and L.A. if you're also traveling there.

Reviews.Title: “Surly staff, worn out rooms”
Reviews.Author: jambie1024
Reviews.Content: First impression of this motel was terrible due to rude front desk staff - no greeting or small talk at all - basically shoved an agreement regarding smoking at me within a minute of checking in. Went to the office on several occasions for directions etc and each time the staff was unfriendly, and unhelpful. The room was " retro" but not in a cool way and was so tiny that I couldn't get out of bed at night without crawling over my husband as the bed was pushed up against the wall. There was a fridge which was nice but in order for it to work you had to unplug the hairdryer so on a couple occassions we forgot to replug in the fridge and came back to warm items in the fridge. The pool was nice (but noisy as it was spitting distance to the highway) and the grounds are pretty, but all in all, there are dozens of places to stay in the area which I am sure are much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, small rooms and worst WIFI”
Reviews.Author: NaKLocutus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the most important sights in San Diego. All of them are reachable within 10 minutes by car. We are traveling with 4 adult people. The rooms are much to small for 4 persons (OK for 2 though). If you are dependant on online services don't use this hotel since it's WIFI isn't working.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and v. good choice for short stay”
Reviews.Author: PeregrinatorNY
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly inexpensive, comfortable and very close to the Town and Country if you're there for a conference. A good choice if you just need a cheap, basic place to stay while in S. Diego with family or on business and aren't looking for resort-type amenities and location. Pool and hot tub available. Staff was friendly and there is a restaurant - food is only average/ acceptable, but the breakfast staff was A++. A prior stay 2 yrs ago was similar and I'll stay there again. Free internet. Compliments to the manager.

Reviews.Title: “BUGS”
Reviews.Author: quoteng
Reviews.Content: im afraid that ll rooms in this place has bugs!!!small and big ones!!! we got a room and reported the bugs to front desk and was transferred to another room, there are still bugs!!!!beware!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dmassion
Reviews.Content: I had to coordinate a family gathering for 5 days in San Diego and had to do it on internet and phone. Best Western Seven Seas turned out to be a wonderful choice. The staff is wonderful, especially Kathy the caterer (wonderful meal at a very reasonable price) and Evelyn (group coordinator). But they were not alone! Everyone on the staff made us feel welcome, comfortable and at ease. The lay-back setting and lush landscape so close to San Diego's Old Town made this an ideal choice for us. Though the rooms were small they were clean and the pools and hot tubs were delightful. We will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Well out the way”
Reviews.Author: rocket_05
Reviews.Content: It seems to be in the middle of nowhere. Rooms are terribly dark and dingy. Bathroom fan sounds like a plane landing. Could hear people in room above walking about all night. Food is poor here. Shuttle service is the only reason we booked this hotel and even that did not run on time. All in all won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “get a lot for whatcha pay”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_IllinoisJim
Reviews.Content: Good deal for the money! Hotel rooms and grounds are clean and inviting. Within about 10 minutes of just about anything you want to do in San Diego. The rooms could have been alittle bigger but not complaining. Front desk saved us with a free shuttle to Airport after a last minute unexpected change. Only downside I had here was bathroom light didnt work, call maintance and he broke glass clover. No big deal till he couldnt fix and even better yet left large glass shards in the tub and on the floor. Thankfully I noticed before taking toddler for his bath! If u plan on being in the room to sleep and being out most of the day exploring all that San Diego has to offer than this hotel is definitely worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “They do more to make your stay enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: kjake60
Reviews.Content: People from my office travel to San Diego several times per year. The Best Western Seven Seas is the only place we will stay. Highly recommend you stay under their Preferred Guest (PG) program. A fantastic value for your Government and Military personnel per diem dollar. Free: Breakfast and dinner buffet, 2 hour open bar, movie tickets, sporting event tickets (limited availability). On weekends your meals will come from the Seven Seas Cafe. The food is excellent (as evidenced by the large number of Police Officers that dine there throughout the day). Everyone goes out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. During a recent two week business trip they rented a recliner from Rent A Center to accommodate my chronic back problem (I can't sleep in a bed). They are conveniently located near just about anything you would want to do in the San Diego area. Sea World, Zoo, etc. 5 minute walk from commuter rail transportation and a large mall. An even larger mall is approx 2-3 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experiences ever!”
Reviews.Author: lcac67en
Reviews.Content: I think I speak for hundreds of contractors, military and government reps when I thank you for the care, friendship, hospitality and respect we receive from ALL of you. You all are unique from everyone else I have ever delt with in this job. You remember us as individuals with a name and not just a face. Our contractors from QED had a great stay last week and due to the great people of Best Western Seven Seas, we made some new friends. Please pass this on to the following and don't forget the unseen staff that make it all come together at BW7S. Zach. Jason, Ruben, Betts, Pam, Rosemary, all the cooks, waiters, waitresses, room cleaning, security. Please allow a special thanks to Joe, the owner for making this all possible. Good man! Unique! My special word for my friends at BW7S Hotel is "Unique".. All Respect And Thanks Steve Ebeling

Reviews.Title: “Getting bit by something... Bed bugs maybe?”
Reviews.Author: ZipheR759
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for several weeks due to business. rooms are smaller than usual. I have been moved to a larger room, but have been getting bit on arms while sleeping, over various nights. Had talked to management. They said, "they cleaned the room". Currently sleeping on extra sheets and pillows over originals to not take chance again. Would recommend spending a little more and staying at another hotel on the strip..

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't go there a second time”
Reviews.Author: globalplayer2010
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is not the best. But a lot of other hotels are there as well. located close to a freeway. Staff was not really friendly at the check in, whereas one staff member was very friendly. The rooms were small and our room was a bit dirty. beach is about a 10 minutes car ride. Pool area is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful People work here”
Reviews.Author: Grammie8
Reviews.Content: My family made a trip to Disneyland and San Diego and I have to say that this hotel has some of the nicest, helpful people I have ever met. They could not do enough for us, from picking us up at the Amtrak station, to taking and picking us up at San Diego Zoo and Seaworld. They recommended restraunts and made our short stay one of the highlights of our trip. I was sorry to leave, it was just a great experience and I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it - would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Ais11
Reviews.Content: Having looked on Tripadvisor before booking the Best Western Seven Seas, I was concerned about what my own experience would be. I really needn't have worried! The room was adequately sized and clean, the maids came in every day and changed the sheets and generally kept the place nice. The actual hotel had pretty gardens leading to the rooms, the pool was pleasant and had a reasonably priced bar next to it. We spent an evening in the bar and met some very friendly people who were also staying in the hotel. Every night was a fantastic night's sleep, it was quiet and the beds were impossibly comfortable! The location was also great, the bus stop for Downtown being right across the road and the Fashion Valley Transit Centre 10 minutes walk away, which was very handy for getting buses to anywhere in the city, as well as bus passes for the week. People have complained about the safety of the complex, the old fashioned rooms and the price of the cafe. I, for one, never found the hotel in any way unsafe. As two young women going to our hotel room at the very back of the property late at night, we could easily have felt that way, but it was perfectly fine. The hotel rooms were slightly outdated, but many hotel rooms are, you can't expect them to match up to the quality of places like the Manchester Grand Hyatt. It didn't bother me that the wallpaper wasn't the best and newest of styles, I was out exploring the city instead of hanging around in my room! Many people have been annoyed at the price of the cafe, but it's pretty much the same price as everywhere else in the city. The food is amazing and the portions are huge! I had a great breakfast there and it kept me sated for much of the day. We sometimes got leaflets through the door from nearby restaurants, but that's hardly a major problem. Don't be lazy - pick them up and put them in the bin! Problem sorted! All in all, it's a decently priced hotel in a good location. I really enjoyed my stay and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not a family hotel, tiny rooms, bad sleep.”
Reviews.Author: bigcop73
Reviews.Content: If you like sleeping in uncomfortable beds in a small room with a huge mirror trying to make the room bigger, and beside the highway, and with other hotels as neighbours, and with nothing to do at night (no restaurants, no places for the kids to play, no shops, nothing, nothing, nothing), you've come to the right place. My spouse, kid and I arrived in San Diego in August and couldn't find a hotel in the city, so we tried the "famous" hotel circle. The Best Western was the only hotel who had a room with 2 queen beds, 2 tiny queen beds. We wanted to stay 9 nights, finally, we just 1 and the next morning we drove away and found a much better room in the Vagabond Inn in Point Loma (15 minutes drive) which is near everything (Sea World, Mission Beach, San Diego).

Reviews.Title: “the room was small enough to make me feel like a sardine”
Reviews.Author: MsBennet57
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms for a total of 8 people we stayed in connecting rooms which was good but the size of the rooms were terrible there wasn't enough room for me and my luggage at the same time! They did have some pluses though i nice lit up area where you could do laundry (outside:( ) with tables where we were able to play a board game the pool was HEATED like just walk in kind of heated which was another good. but over all i don't think i could get over just how small the room is especially for the price i had to pay. I don't think I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to attractions - great pool/hot tub”
Reviews.Author: KellyTraveler96
Reviews.Content: Just off I-8, so Seaworld. Mission Beach and the Zoo were easy to get to. 8 minutes from the Zoo, 6 minutes to Seaworld and the beach. (afternoon traffic was bad on the way home, though.) Also our teen girls loved the very nearby Fashion Mall, and one day we took the tram into downtown, using the nearby PArk'n'Ride. Very easy. The pool was lovely and warm! The hot tub was hot! Most hotels' are not. Clean rooms, a little worn out (doors splintered a little, caulking was sloppy) but affordable. The bathroom was small but a littel dressing area was OK. Small fridge. Ask for a second floor in the back - we stayed in 226 and it was so quiet even though the hotel is right on the freeway. Guest washer/dryers were great. ($6 washed and dried 2 loads) I would rather stay here than at the Hilton in L.A.X., where the pool was cold, the hot tub was tepid, the beds were smaller, the halls were louder, etc. Staff was happy to get us extra pillows, blankets and towels.

Reviews.Title: “park & cruise”
Reviews.Author: Mytoy264
Reviews.Content: Would like information from people who parked their car there while they went on their cruise? Was it safe place? Did they watch your car? Was there any problems to & from the cruise dock?

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DEAL, GEAT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: sgsdcal
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for some fun and relaxation and the Seven Seas was just the place, The staff at the hotel was GREAT! The front desk we're helpful and imformative. The staff in the cafe were fun and friendly. We hung out at the pool, used the jacuzzi and took advantage of the fitness room. The hotel also has a great shuttle service. We were able to take advantage of it and use to go to Old Town and the Harbor. All in all for the price we paid it was well worth it and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Looking”
Reviews.Author: DAW98
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tired looking. Could use better maintenance. The sink drained slow and the weak battery in the smoke detector woke me up at midnight the first night there. I had to let security in to disable the smoke detector and it was 2 days later before it was replaced. The front desk was not very knowledgeable about places to eat, etc. I asked for a chinese restaurant and they told me to go to the mall for PF Changs. After walking around for a while at the mall, I was told that PFChangs was not in the mall but in the parking lot outside Bloomingdale's. When I said something to the front desk,, they were very defensive. I did not particularly like hotel circle since the only convienent places to eat were the hotel restaurants. When I return to San Diego, I defin itely would not stay here again. The beds were comfortable and free parking were the only good points.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: stillhouse1
Reviews.Content: We liked staying on Hotel Circle which was very convenient to major highways, all sections of San Diego and stores. Since the Padres were out of town and the Globe summer theatre productions hadn't started we were happy to shop in the evenings. This hotel was basic but clean and the price was great-$64. One minor inconvenience was that there was only one outlet which could be used for either the built in hairdryer, the small refrigerator or the iron (the one in our room was broken anyway). I wouldn't recommend this hotel for an extended stay, but for two nights it was fine. Consider asking for a room on the grassy courtyard between buildings. I'd also definitely opt for a second story room since this is an older motel with exterior entrances and noise could be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: samjluck
Reviews.Content: This place is clean and nice for the money. Older place but well kept. Location is perfect to see all of San Diego's wonders. I would stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Your basic 2-tier hotel that looks more like an apartment complex than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nrs1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in mid-May of 2010. I requested a quiet room and the front desk staff were good enough to get me a room away from the freeway and the hot-tub. The rooms to the back of the property face a hill side and that kept things quiet and also not having noisy neighbors worked in my favor for some solitude.
