Location- the hotel is located right along the 8 Freeway so getting on and off the freeway is very convenient. The Fashion Mall is about 2 miles away and is easily accesible via surface streets. Room- the room is basic with a full size bed. No frills. Your basic 70's furniture and art decor. I appreciated having a small fridge, hair-dryer and cofee-maker. The TV had cable but with very limited channels, the good stuff (i.e movies and recent episodes of your favorite shows) cost money. There is a computer desk in the room that served adequately for my lap top. However, I had to use the outlet behind the TV, that luckily had a 6-prong outlet to plu in my laptop and blue-tooth for the night. Service- The like to change your sheets every other day unless you specifically request that it be changed daily. They did not leave any plastic bags in the trash bins but luckily I brought some plastic grocery bags that I implemented as trash bags. The Bed- I got a full size bed that needed replacing and only 2 standard synthetic-fill pillows. Food- There is a restaurant next to the front desk that is decent. There is NO complimentary breakfast and NO complimentary afternoon snacks or drinks at this hotel. Parking- Parking is abundant but the spaces are very compact and perhaps parking away from your room might be a better idea especially if you need space to get things in and out of your car. And, also, there is no elevator to the second floor and some of the stairwells to the second-floor looked as though it was ready to collapse. So be careful. Amenities- I saw a pool but it was closed for some type of work, I know this hotel had a gym but I never saw it, and they had about 2 hot-tubs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jusjack58
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay,helpful, friendly staff,clean rooms,excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: SCRAPBOOKINGFAN
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked like an apartment complex more than a hotel. The interior of the rooms looks outdated. The pool was nice and they had a few hot tubs scattered around the property. They gym was really clean and overlooked the pool area. There is a restraunt inside and the staff was very friendly and we had a great breakfast. They also have mini pizzas there, mine was delicious. The restaurant had both indoor and outdoor seating. Overall, we did have a good experience and will probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Audreybella
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little nervous. I don't know what everyone is expecting when booking this hotel but this isn't the Ritz Carlton. I think it is worth ever penny. It was small and comfortable, the only thing I hated was the pillows but that's because I like my pillows thin. Bed was comfortable, the pool was large enough, also had a separate jacuzzi area. There was a gym but i did not use it.The location is also very good. I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there, not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: zoonnbee
Reviews.Content: Room was very small. Electric outlets or lack of were unsafe. Sofas in lobby were all torn. Front desk woman kept talking in spanish on the phone in my face, very rude. I left and went to another hotel. They wouldnt give my money back. I have e mailed and phoned the manager with no response. When we first entered the room we were over powered by a trrible odor.

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Particularlady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and very well maintained. The landscaping is beautiful. The workout room has the latest equipment (TV's on the treadmill, bicycle, and elliptical - bring your headphones). The rooms are small and basic but very clean. The only complaint would be the lack of electrical outlets in the room. We had a refrig. but couldn't keep it plugged up because we needed the outlet. All-in-all, if you are looking for a place to rest your head that's clean and affordable this is your spot. If you want the high end hotel experience this may not be the hotel for you. The hotel restaurant was very good but pricey. My family and I enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if You Have to be at Town and Country”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within walking distance to the Town and Country Hotel and Conference center. So if you want do save some $$$ you can stay here as opposed to paying top dollar over at Town and Country. Keep in mind you have to walk under a highway overpass to get to Town and Country. The hotel is basic, a place to sleep. Make sure while you're there you walk down the street and have a drink at the Beef Inn. It is truly a unique experience. Before you book directly with the hotel check prices on Priceline or Hotels.com The hotel has a shuttle service and they were very kind to pick me up from Old Town and bring me back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “attacked by Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: HandsumMuscle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Seven Seas for 2 nights. The first night I noticed a bite or two on myself and didn't really think anything of it. The second night I woke up to several bites on my face and over ten on my back and legs. They are clearly bed bug bites. Hotwire was good about getting me out of there and giving me a $100 voucher towards another hotel. I'd much rather of not been attacked by bed bugs and give the $100 back since I'm on vacation and was hoping on going to the beach or to be able to lie by the pool. I can't do that because my legs and face are covered by big red ugly welts. I travel a lot, this happened to me about a year ago and I recall the welts taking about a week to go away :( .... Well I knew I shouldn't of trusted a hotel that only got 2.5 stars. Like they say you get what you pay for. First of all the hotel "complex" is a monstrosity. It looks like an apartment complex in a really poor neighborhood. It doesn't get any better once you get in the room. The room was really tiny and outdated, no better than an old Motel 6 room. I would of stuck it out for the last 2 days of my stay had I not been attacked by bugs. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I have stayed at well over 200 hotels the last 2 years and this one definately ranks at the bottom of that last and that was BEFORE the bed bugs made a meal out of me. When I called the girl at the front desk to tell here I'm checking out early because I had been attacked by bed bugs she goes "ohhh I'm sorry". I have a hard time believing she doesn't hear this on a regular basis. The Manager should of been on the phone taking care of my paid 2 nights and crossing his fingers that I didn't come on some review site to speak the truth. The one time I was attacked by bed bugs in Pittsburght at least the manager had the sense to take care of my stay, I did not review that hotel, maybe I should have but since the Manager was so nice and told me it was an isolated incidence I took here word for it. It's called customer service and this dump lacks in that too!!! I am very tempted to post a picture of one of my legs that are covered in red welts but I'd hate to gross anyone out.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Experience could have been done at Super 8”
Reviews.Author: Raczkal
Reviews.Content: The grounds were amazing! But the room itself was way smaller than expected. Very small in comparison to the online description. There wasn't even a microwave to heat food so all the food we brought sat there and we had to eat out every meal. One plus was that there was direct outdoor entry and room service was great. Thank goodness it was just me and my friend! Even though our room was a 2 bed I wouldn't want to imagine fitting any more people in. I've stayed in nicer Super 8...which was right next door at a friendly price...

Reviews.Title: “Super Short Showers”
Reviews.Author: 4zag614
Reviews.Content: I travel quite frequently for business, and my most recent conference happened to be at this hotel. The rooms are clean in typical BW fashion. However, instead of being a more upscale property given the price of rooms and location, they are small. There is hardly any walking room between all the furniture. That wouldn't be so bad, if it weren't for the bathroom. I am 5'5" and I have to contort my body and "shrink" to take a shower. The shower head hits me in the throat if I walked right up to it. Other problems I had: one morning I had to take a lukewarm shower as there was not enough hot water left from others who had showered. My fridge froze everything on the warmest setting.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay for those not planning to stay in the room”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: Good deal found online, free parking, pool,jacuzzi, fitness room. It was just a home base for new years eve, as most hotels were charging a ridiculous amount of money for the night. Spent a little under a Grant(Ulysses S) so if you can find it around the same, i'd recommend booking.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: bungadoo
Reviews.Content: I just returned from San Diego and had a wonderful time. I found the city to be very beautiful and the people quite friendly, including those at the Seven seas. The staff was always very helpful. The grounds of the hotel were quite pretty and well kept and our room was always clean. The room was, however, a bit smaller than expected and I was a tad dissapointed at how far from the pool we were, considering I had emailed the hotel requesting to be closer as I had two small children. One other thing I found to be a little inconvienent was that there was only one plug in for the fridge, coffee maker and hair dryer so you had to unplug one to plug in the other, not a huge deal but strange none the less. The trolley and bus were close by and easy to navigate. My best peice of advice if you stay in this area is try to spend as much time out and about as possible and return to the hotel late as there is not a lot of restatraunts (or anything) around to walk to, and the area was not the kind of place I would walk around at night with kids. (which I found surprising, being it the "hotel circle") Plus, the hotels restaraunt was way overpriced. I did order from one of the flyers I found stuck under my door and it was sooo good. (Im sorry, I cant remember the name, but it was a pizza, pasta place, very reasonable) There is a mini mart down the street but as I mentioned, go there in the day. My husband was followed by some sketchy individuals one night.(same goes for the fashion valley mall, its close to walk, but kind of weird after dark) They have a complimentary shuttle at the hotel which will take you to the attractions, just sign up the day before, but I found most everything to be close enough that a cab wasn't too unreasonable either. All in all, I enjoyed my stay at the best western seven seas. Like I mentioned, the staff were great . I do think, however, that if I return to San diego, I would stay somewhere that had more amenities around it, preferably closer to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Park N Cruisers”
Reviews.Author: JennyandJoeS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights prior to going on a Holland American Cruise. Room is small, but clean. New comfortable pillow top mattresses, good shower and the air conditioner worked great - what more could you ask for. Ate in the restaurant, food and service very good, prices very reasonable. Front desk was courteous and efficient. Lots of choices of restaurants in the near vicinity. Parked our car there for 15 days during our cruise, paid $129 (that included one night's stay). That is a bargain in San Diego. Felt very secure about leaving the car, although the hotel did request that we leave our car keys with them. They have a little bus that they use to shuttle passengers to/from cruise terminal free. The hotel landscaping is beautiful. Lots of flowering plants, even at the end of November.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable For San Diego”
Reviews.Author: bravo1950
Reviews.Content: san Diego is an expensive city to stay in so this motel on Hotel Circle is a reasonable value. The rooms are a little small,but decent. They are not as clean as could be and have a bit of a musty odor,which is typical of many budget motels in the area. Wi Fi and parking are included and the locatio is good. Staff is for the most part rude or at best indifferent. Overall an OK place to stay but not spend a lot of time at.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty front desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: sunbird1942
Reviews.Content: PRO: The hotel is well-placed on Hotel Circle and the grounds were nice. The food in the restaurant was good, albeit expensive. The wait staff, with one exception - a warm and chaming young lady from Eastern Europe - was pedestrian. I felt very comfortable with the 5 police officers who met one day for lunch. It indicated to me that the restaurant had a good local reputation for its food. The pool area was nice and pleasant to relax at. Free internet was nice as well. Management is concerned with their image and were quick to my complaint to Best Western headquarters - see below. CON: The room was too small and very uncomfortable and every request to upgrade to a larger room was met with disdain and "if you're not happy with the room, go somewhere else," or "Don't let the door hit you in the back." This happened 3 days in a row. They were rude and obnoxious. On the last day I requested a late checkout and was treated, once again, very badly by the Front Desk Staff - they were extremely rude and obnoxious. One of them actually sneered at me. I asked to speak to the manager and was told he was unavailable, but I did speak to a Customer Service Clerk and she was very helpful. We were allowed a late checkout (5:45 p.m.) and were fully charged for an extra night. Oh, and I never did get to speak to the manager. When I returned home, I called Best Western and filed a complaint. To my suprise 3 hours later, I received a phone call from the manager who was too busy to talk to me that day. We had a pleasant and fruitful exchange re my experience - he apologized and we discussed the need for better training of his front desk staff. I was not offered any consideration to return and the hotel never forwarded my stay to Best Western and I never received credit for my stay in their Rewards program. I have stayed in literally hundreds of hotels (including BW) all around the country and I've never been treated so shabbily. I was positively impressed with the speed and personal response to my complaint (Kudos to Steve!), but it does not mitigate how I was treated. Hopefully the staff has been retrained and have been taught the proper treatment of guests and without those guests, they would not have jobs.I would not recommend this hotel to friends or family, because I can not be sure that they will not receive the same nasty treatment I did. Lastly, prior to San Diego, I stayed at the BW Carriage Inn in Sherman Oaks for 6 nights and the front desk staff went out of their way to make our stay pleasant and that our business was appreciated. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay in San Diego, CA”
Reviews.Author: Veroni411
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very convinient in Hotel Circle, San Diego. The room was roomy and very comfortable to sleep in. The room was nice and clean, however, room service for towels took a while. Overall, our stay was peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western it is not!”
Reviews.Author: rhinestonericky
Reviews.Content: Pool is 85 degrees and will breed more disease than the toilet seats. I fear the next few days. Have to move furniture to find an outlet. I found an outlet that almost fell out into my hand. One mattress was totally useless and advised front desk at 9:00 am. At 6:00 I found the bed stripped but not changed. At 7:00 pm I asked the front desk about the status? No response. At 7:30 house keeper shows up and looks at mattress and declares nothing is wrong and leaves. After several minutes I called the front desk to ask when someone will be making the bed. If I didn't, the bed would never have been made. Also, watch out for LIGHT switch in the shower. That is right. Light witch is located in the shower. Ok, the plastic curtain does keep the water off the switch (maybe). Talk about safety hazards and fire hazards. Switches usually break and can arc and burn your hand with 3rd degree burns. Fires start in the wall from arcing wires. This hotel is begging for a monumental legal bill. Furniture is OLD, restaurant is over priced. The bar is located off the pool and all the old men come out to smoke next to the pool. Nice for the kids. Find a better hotel on the strip...

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Not worth the money they charge, not as described!”
Reviews.Author: Emalleth
Reviews.Content: Only positives: WiFi is free. Lots of hot water...scalding hot Lots of negatives: Staff not very friendly, just doing what they need to get people out of office area. No elevator, VERY small cramped rooms. We had to drive to our room because it was so far there was no option of walking. Bugs in room. One power outlet available in entire room, and it was right next to the door. The beds felt like cardboard, the pillow (one about half normal size per person) was worst I have ever had. One power socket (not a double one) in vanity area to supply the coffee maker, refrigerator and hair dryer. Bath area so small you cannot dress in it after a shower (hope you don't need any privacy from traveling companions). Shower leaks on floor no matter what you do. Toilet wobbles from side to side. Mildew on tile, and not just in hard to get to places...all over. TV not fully functioning. Pool such a hike away, we didn't bother going the 4 buildings to get to it. A 2 star Motel at best. Very over priced for what we got. We will never recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not too fancy, but just right!”
Reviews.Author: mmgamg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the San Diego Comic Con and for the price we found it was fantastically convenient, away from the traffic on Hotel Circle and within 5 - 10 min walk to the Fashion Mall Trolley station, or easy drive to park there. The hotel service was refreshingly good, the request for extra bedding and towels were expedient and all the staff were very friendly and offered great directions for where we needed to go. The kids loved the pool area and well stocked vending machines are every where! The cafe was kind of pricey for a family of four, but the food was good and the staff were smiling and friendly. Our room had two double beds, but we didn't realize how cramped the room would be, but luckily big enough to squeeze a twin air mattress for one of the boys ( I thankfully had an inkling the beds would be too small for two large teenagers to share). Next time we will opt for a family suite or 2 queen beds as we plan to go to comic con again next year! It was a lot of fun and this hotel made the experience much more enjoyable. They really are in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel if you are a heavy sleeper!”
Reviews.Author: AliciaCA30
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about this hotel since the rates were super cheap for July 4th weekend, but the reviews seemed good and I wanted to stay somewhere with a hot tub. When we arrived, the front desk employees were great and were able to give us a room with two beds instead of the one with a queen bed that we had to book online. Our room in the back was very close to the freeway, so I would recommend asking for one of the rooms in the middle of the hotel. When we opened the door, our room was stuffy and smelled like stale cigarette smoke despite this being a non-smoking hotel. As a result, we kept our window open the entire time we were in the room, which made all of the outside noise worse. On our first morning, one of the other hotel visitors who was parked directly below our room decided to open all of his truck's windows and blast rap music at around 8:00 am. The next morning, we had a bunch of kids and loud parents walking past our room all morning talking at full voices despite us having our privacy sign on the door. I did wear earplugs the second night and slept much better than the first! On our second night, we were tired from a day at the zoo and decided to hit the hot tub. We had to go to the front desk to get towels and were extremely disappointed to find 5-10 kids clustered in the hot tub when we returned. After the kids left, we were even more disappointed to find that the hot tub was almost as cold as the pool. Luckily, one of the kids told us about another hot tub around the corner that was actually hot, which made up for our negative experience. Several people raved about the hotel restaurant but we couldn't bring ourselves to eat there despite it being pretty crowded. We also noticed the San Diego Police tend to frequent the joint. Despite the room being small, it was clean and well-maintained. Our only complaint was that there is only one electrical outlet in the bathroom area, so if you have the refrigerator plugged in, you have to unplug it if you want to blow dry your hair, make coffee, or use the iron. Parking is free, which is nice considering some hotels charge over $20 a day! Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you need a clean, cheap, and centrally-located place to stay with a pool/hot tub and don't mind dealing with the loud, inconsiderate hotel guests who seem to frequent this place!

Reviews.Title: “What can I say......it was SCARY, SMALL, DIRTY, AND IT HAD A WEIRD SMELL.”
Reviews.Author: jlu2
Reviews.Content: We were here on vacation. Over the years, we have always had confidence in Best Western hotels, which is why we chose to stay at this particular location. We walked in the room and right away, there was a really weird smell. The decor was horrible, the room was small and very cramped. But we were so tired and my partner was not feeling well, so we decided to stay anyway. After being in the room for a while, I noticed that the coffee cups were stained with coffee. It looked like they quickly wiped off the cup with a wrag, but missed a spot. I was completely disgusted after that. After this visit, I will never stay here again. And I will be visiting other hotel chains beside Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franr123
Reviews.Content: I took my almost 13 year old niece to San Diego. We stayed 5 nights at this hotel for a total bill of $307 which is really cheap for San Diego. That price got us a room with 2 queen beds right by the pool (room 103). Room was small as others said but not as small as I thought it would be. There was one night stand between the beds but we could walk around the other sides. The room also had a desk with chair, a dresser, and an upholstered chair. I thought the beds could be more comfortable. There is a plug issue with two outlets where refrig, blow dryer and coffee maker plug in. It wasn't too much of an issue because we just unplugged the refrig when we briefly needed the other appliances. Mirrors didn't bother us and they do make the room feel larger. Room was very clean, bedding was clean and of fairly good guality. Probably the biggest negative was thin walls and doors that you could not close quietly. So we heard noise above us and we were bolted awake one morning by a neighbor 's slamming door at 6:30am. Plenty of free parking. beautiful grounds, sparkling clean pool, nice jacuzzi and great location. Hotel shuttle driver was very nice and reception crew was always helpful. I also appreciated the free computer in the lobby to print our boarding passes. I would stay at this hotel on another trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The courtesy of the staff extends beyond the time of the stay.”
Reviews.Author: RunningPedestrian
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at this hotel and again we felt comfortable and satisfied with the service, convenient location and cleanliness at a reasonable price. This time we did the unthinkable -- we forgot our daughter's three little friends, toy animals and a doll. Upon our request for urgent help the hotel staff replied promptly and send us the toys in a timely manner. We would be happy to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: Trespinos
Reviews.Content: This is a much larger, sprawling facility than it appears when you first drive in. We were in the 500's building, way in the back, and were surprised at how quiet it was, given the proximity to the freeway and all the other hotels on "hotel circle." Check-in and -out were quick and simple, with the predictable college kids handling the chore (SDSU is about three exits away). The room was a little small, and configured with the vanity/sink outside the shower/commode room. The television is situated so that you must sit or lie on the bed if you want to watch it, and that's not entirely comfortable in the long haul. The a/c unit seemed to operate on its own initiative--changing the fan and temperature settings didn't seem to make a lot of difference... Plenty of vending machines down below, including ice cream, candy and multiple machines for drinks. My wife doesn't like the smell of coffee brewing, so I walked to the lobby on the morning of our first day--no go. They don't provide coffee, but directed me to the adjacent restaurant, where they happily sold me a small cup of coffee in a styrofoam cup for $2.99. Come on.... All in all, it was a decent room for a decent price on a Memorial Day weekend when 10,000 SDSU students (including my son) were graduating... Definitely a step up from a couple of the places we've stayed on this same strip, including the Vagabond which I urge you to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “The Dirty Seas strike again...”
Reviews.Author: inalaki
Reviews.Content: Family of three including toddler, stayed for 5 days while husband attended a conference at a neighboring hotel. The first night we had to change rooms because they only gave us 1 bed even though we called ahead to ask for 2 or a king. That first room was okay, a little small, but seemingly clean enough- Located in the back of the property facing the hill. They switched us to a king room but it was DISGUSTING! There was a smell in the bathroom that we just could not live with a week. It was like mildew and cleaning products- Just really gross and dirty all around- definately not one of the 'newly renovated'. It was late by this time and not wanting to be a problem we slept in the gross room but asked to change the next morning. Our final room's bathroom was okay and the odor of the room was not overwhelming so we stayed. The parking, while conveniently in front of the room was usually taken up by the maintenance staff who regularly coned off and parked there during the day. Trees or no trees this place is RIGHT next to the freeway- If you stay there ask for a room at the back of the property w/o the freeway view. The staff in the front office was not great bordering on rude- They double charged us as we payed for one night with cash and they put it on our credit card as well! it took them a full day to correct this citing that whoever was in the office at the time was unable to reverse the charge- ridiculous! There was internet service which was much appreciated and useful in detecting the overcharge. Their cleaning staff was great and friendly and we felt they were an upside to the place. It is in hotel circle which is close to shopping and an easy drive to hillcrest as well as old town and you couldn't get closer to the freeway if you were on it. The hotel was chosen by the conference and we don't think they or we got our moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelCouple
Reviews.Content: Easy on/off freeway location, but without the usual excessive freeway noise thanks to its location and trees. Onsite coffee shop has only a basic breakfast menu, but lunch and dinner offerings have a larger range of selections. Plenty of parking within easy walking distance of the rooms. No elevator, though, so if you cannot handle steps comfortably be sure to ask for a ground-floor room. Small bar is quiet, and not near any rooms, so late night noise is not a problem. Service is great, but closing time varies according to how busy it is (especially Sun-Thurs), so don't always count on a late nightcap. Website says 'newly renovated,' and while everything was modern, clean, and comfortably appointed, our king bed was too soft for our taste -- maybe the mattress set was part of the renovation, maybe not, but that was the only distraction from a great value.

Reviews.Title: “A little below average, but not not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: sfbay22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights in this Best Western while visiting San Diego. This hotel seems to be one of the older ones on hotel circle. The location is fine, as convenient to San Diego tourist attraction as the others on the circle, as long as you have a car. The property was very large (4 or 5 buildings) and decently maintained, but a pretty dull bare bones chain hotel. While it was one of the cheapest options for us in San Diego, we would probably spend the extra $10 or $20 per night to go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DIVE”
Reviews.Author: sbf2002
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego for a quick 2-night stay with the family for a Dodgers V. Padres game. Stayed at the Best Western Seven Seas and after checking in and getting our room, decided to only stay one-night and check out. The room was like an old apartment. Dirty, hard cardboard beds, just scary. The morning of check out, there was a cockaroach running around the sink. It was like a bad scary movie. The staff is friendly and the landscape is very nice, but the rooms are gross. We couldn't wait to check out and get home. Never again. I'm calling Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean + great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Best Western Seven Seas in San Diego during the Valentine's Day weekend. The hotel is set at the base of a hill, it has lots of beautiful flowers growing on its grounds, and it is close to everything! The room was quite spacious and VERY CLEAN. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was spotless! The staff was very pleasant to deal with. There is a restaurant on their premises that we used for breakfasts. They do have low-fat and vegetarian options, which was an added bonus. The hotel is 10 minutes drive from Sea World, Old Town and Piers. It was a perfect location! We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel with nice surroundings”
Reviews.Author: goldcardluke
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a United Airlines package which included flights and accommodation to Las Vegas, LA, San Diego and San Francisco. I really liked this hotel. Although it is next to a motorway, the tropical plants and palm trees seem to block most of the noise. The room was a little small for all our luggage, but other than that it was fine. Comfy bed, plenty of towels, good choice of TV channels and handy connecting door to our friends room next door. I made use of the outdoor hot tub and heated pool â€“ both were very nice. We ate in the restaurant for dinner and breakfast a couple of times. It was never particularly busy so the service was good. The restaurant is casual and has a nice selection. We went to the bar a couple of times which was small and friendly. The staff at the front desk was helpful and ordered taxis for us â€“ Sea World and the Gaslamp Quarter is about 15 minutes ride away. The only thing I disliked about this hotel was that our room was on the second floor which meant carrying our heavy cases up the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful gardens - small nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Railhistoryfan
Reviews.Content: On the north side of San Diego off I-8 is a large selection of hotels. In the Hotel Circle, visitors will find something in every price range and hotel type. The Best Western Seven Seas is an older property that is well maintained. The small rooms are typical of the 1960's and 1970's. Two story buildings allow you to park at the door. Rooms are tight with little extra space. The bed, desk and tv occupy the front of the room, the enclosed toilet/ shower in the corner and the sink in the bedroom area. Our room was clean, featured new furniture and a 25" TV with a good selection of channels. Each day housekeeping did a complete serving of the room. The grounds are decorated with palm trees and other sub tropical vegetation. The result is very calming and it should absorb some of the highway noise. The restaurant was average. Breakfast was the typical eggs and bacon -- very little healthy food. Service was uneven -- no refill on our coffee - they charged $2.95 for the 'never empty' cup. If you want more quiet, ask for a room away from the highway. This is not the least expensive property on Hotel Circle, but the well maintained gardens, park at the door convenience, on site restaurant/ bar and good management deserve your consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for free cruise parking.”
Reviews.Author: StevenSueLasVegas_NV
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were leaving on a two week cruise from San Diego. We were driving from Las vegas and didn't want to pay $200.00+ for parking. This Best western offered a room for $129.00 with two weeks free parking including a shuttle to and from the ship. This was a great deal since we were gong to spend a night in San Diego anyway. The parking and shuttle worked out fine. The property is older and a little tired but very clean and well maintained. It has a very nice restaurant and bar as well as a nice pool and spa. The staff is friendly and helpful but not very efficient. The negatives are that the air conditioning system smelled musty, the walls are paper thin, you can hear a shower running three rooms away, they had one small bar of soap, no shampoo, only two small pillows and one single coffee packet. we would stay there again if we went on another cruise from San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Escape”
Reviews.Author: RCMaui
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. Some of the rooms are located near the freeway, but they have a section in the back of the property which is very quiet and nice. The landscaping is nicely done and the staff were so pleasaant and accomadating. It was reasonable pricewise, and located within 10 or 15 minutes of most tourist activities. The restaurant was good for breakfast before starting out on our days activities. Although, a little pricey, the service was good at the restaurant. The room was a little small, but the bathroom area and vanity area very nice. Overall, we were quite surprised at how nice the hotel was, and would stay there again when we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, just nice.”
Reviews.Author: DoubleBBs
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife needed a little time to ourselves and thought San Diego would be the perfect place. It was more of a last minute trip and were looking for a good deal. After searching and reading reviews on the internet we chose the Seven Seas. Check in was nice and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I admit the room was a little small but everything worked and it was clean. The pool are was very nice and we were able to sit out by the pool read our books and relax. They will even serve drinks at the pool. We ate in the cafe one time for breakfast and it was very good. They waiter was excellent. On our last night we wanted to go out for dinner. We did not want to drive and the hotel had a shuttle service that shuttled us to the waterfront and then returned later to pick us up. This was complimentary and a very nice convenience. We really enjoyed our stay and will return to the hotel the next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Average motel, but excellent location with great resturant”
Reviews.Author: devorzon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in late July and liked it enough to stay there again. Free parking right by room, although I notice the parking lot was pretty dark at night. Doesn't bother me but single women traveling alone might care. Room was just average, with dated looking furnishings, and a carpet that needed to be replaced soon. Still it was clean, and it didn't have an "old room" smell. Came with a handy small fridge, iron/ironing board, coffee maker and hair dryer. There was also a place laundry place in the back of the property that came in handy. I really like the hotel resturant, Seven Seas Cafe. Had excellent food and very friendly servers. They also had room service from this resturant up until 10pm which was great. The last night there had a gourmet pizza and salad through room service and it came pretty quick. There's a sundries/liquor shop about a block away by the gas station that you can easily walk to for stuff like toothpaste and beer.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect much!”
Reviews.Author: Kalifornia77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location with my brother in law while attending Comic-con in San Diego. With all the hotels downtown sold out, this was the closest we could get that wouldnt cost us $175 a night. After reading some of the reviews on here, ill admit I was pretty weary about what to expect. Let me just say that this is NOT the hotel to stay at if your traveling with children or trying to have a romantic getaway with a girl. We were two guys who only needed a bed and a shower and didnt much care about anything else since we would be at the convention pretty much from 8am to about midnight or later, had I been traveling with my wife or any children, it would have been a disaster. THE BAD The main problem is that the rooms are small, VERY small. We had the room with two beds in it and we literally could not walk around without hitting the desk, the bed, or each other. We kept thinking, how are couples with two kids doing this!? There was also a serious lack of power outlets in the room. The mini fridge was not plugged in becasue where it was located there was only one outlet and the coffee pot was plugged into it. (the smallest coffee pot known to man by the way, and the in room coffee was HORRIBLE). Unfortunately, it gets worse. The room was pretty dark, there are two lamps, each one with about a 20W bulb in it and that is the main source of light in the room. The only other light is the one over the sink wich is bright enough for the bathroom, but doesnt help lighting the room. The room was also not very clean, carpets were dingy and stained, way past their lifespan. There was also a roach caught in the light above the toliet for 3 days, someone removed it i guess on the last day we were there. And another one on the bathroom floor. Sink was clogged, took water like 20 min to drain. THE GOOD The bed was comfy and the AC and shower worked great, which is again all we really cared about. The grounds were really very nice and the pool and hottub looked clean and not over-crowded, we didnt go in either. We didnt eat at the hotel resteraunt, couldnt see paying $14 for a burger with Fuddrucker's like 3 min away. Thats about it for the good. We got what we needed for the price we were willing to pay but again know what your getting before you go, AAA is pushing the limit calling this place a 2-diamond hotel. I have a feeling when the next guide comes out they will not get that same rating. The grounds are great but the rooms are in dire need of an overhaul, new carpet, more power, more light, and a deep cleaning are all needed at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dawn52
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research trying to find a place that wouldn't break the bank and was close to major attractions. It was clean and comfortable. Parking was free. The food at the restaurant is good, but a bit high. The pool was a little scummy as was the second hot tub outside the pool. It is a safe place to stay for families and me. A gas station is near by. Those are hard to come by in SD. Easy access to the freeway but I did not hear any freeway noise. The inside colors were green and orange with tropical paintings. There isn't a store at the hotel but a few hotels down there is a mini-market. The staff was friendly and the check in was not long. I didn't hear anyone through the walls or clomping upstairs. Maybe I was too tired. The air conditioner had a smell when first started but disapeared as I got used to it. The humidity in SD made 76 degrees hot so I had the cool or fan going all the time. It didn't make any noise. They do have sliding windows. There is a coffee maker, hair dryer, and a small fridge. I like that and it came in handy. The only ice machine was behind the hotel by the laundry and vending machines. The laundry area was outside. Vending machine with soda and water by the pool also mid way between rooms. Ample parking, I do want to thank them for not charging for it like some places have done after having free parking for years. They do charge the marketing Tourist Assessment fee but every major tourist trap does. I enjoyed my stay over all and would return. Perhaps they should put no children allowed in the hot tub in Spanish in the hot tub area. I didn't notice a sign in the area just the kids. The information in the room said no children allowed in the hot tub. They think it's fun to play in the bath water.

Reviews.Title: “Decent No Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrngway
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night during a week stay in San Diego. We were unfamiliar with the area and after searching websites, booked through bestwestern.com. We would have stayed longer, but ended up getting a better deal through Priceline that night. The front desk staff was polite and didn't have a problem when we reduced our stay from 4 nights to 1. Overall the room was nice and the bed was comfortable and the furniture and overall look tasteful. One light bulb would not stay on and kept flickering. The bathroom was adequate, but certainly nothing to write home about. It had been renovated not too long ago. The shower spout was on crooked and it looked a little run down, but everything worked allright. Wireless internet is available and free. We weren't able to log on for a couple attempts, but were finally successful. The connection speed was fine. Breakfast wasn't included in our reservation. The hotel is located in a strip of hotels and there isn't much for food within walking distance. It's next to a highway, but the noise really wasn't intrusive and didn't bother us. This is a relatively inexpensive, no frills hotel in a safe area. If that's what you're looking for, than I'd definitely recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “You can by your Union Tribune around the corner...”
Reviews.Author: bittersweet28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location with my beau. He lives in San Diego about 10 minutes away. We wanted a night away from friends and family. We are very familiar with the area, the rate was good and best western is typically very decent. I don't recommend this place if you are a couple looking for a getaway or a romantic evening. I arrived in the evening. Check-in was a breeze. Our room was on the very back of the lot in a 2nd story building. There was a lot of commotion in the parking lot. tweens running around, people making lots of noise etc. It must have taken me almost 10 minutes to locate the room. All room #s are poorly lit and impossible to see from even a few yards away. So park your car, bring a flashlight and start looking... The room was tiny and had recently been finished/remodeled. I think there was still a paint can or filler right outside our room with some tools. The A/C wasn't working and it happened to be a humid weekend. The free wifi didn't work. When I called the 800# they couldn't fix it either. In the morning, like most San Diegans we like to read the Tribune. When I walked all the way to the front desk to request, the lady said it's around and the corner and it will cost you 50cents. she was rude and I was bothered. What it really kill them to offer a free paper to guests? Ironically the trib, is about 50 yards away on the other side of the 8 fwy. I will not stay here in the future and unless you will be sightseeing all day or you are at soccer tournament or sporting event with lots of kids, I wouldn't recommend staying here...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff only added to the value!”
Reviews.Author: sgsdcal
Reviews.Content: It all started with the reservation. After calling a few other properties in the area I called the Seven Seas. I spoke with the girl in reservation for about 5 minutes and she gave a ton of information on the area and answered all my questions. When you drive up to the hotel you can't help but notice the landscaping. It's beautiful. Check in was quick an efficient and we received the room we requested. We were in town to take my 2 kids to Sea World and the Zoo. The hotel has free shuttle service to both and it was great! Our 3rd day we didn't have any plans and the front desk gave us some great ideas and we were able to take advantage of the shuttle again. The room was clean and comfortable. It was a little small but who goes to San Diego to sit in your room all day. The staff as great and we'll definitely go back. If you get a chance try the Cafe. The food is a little pricey for a Cafe but it was good and the waiters were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Still a disappointment.....”
Reviews.Author: gordyc48
Reviews.Content: ...with the inconsistencies from last year eg. dark & dingy rooms, soiled carpeting and moldy spots were some negatives in this centrally located hotel. It wasn't a good situation but we were stuck with it for this past trip out. This is meant as an FYI to viewers beware. Management needs to put some money into improvements. We as patrons feel cheated with substandard conditions on several of the many rooms we rented during an athletic tournament. Freeway accessibility and curb appeal was misleading.......improvements need to be made still. My regrets. Still mad in Fremont, CA.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western of the Dirty Seas”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelcali
Reviews.Content: This was a just an ok stop over. We tried to get into the Best Western Hacienda where we have stayed in the past, however, they were full, so we tried the 7 seas and got something less than just ok. Very small rooms. We didn't even stay for the breakfast since we there was a bad taste left over from staying in the room. We'll definately make our reservations earlier next time to ensure a room at the other Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: alwaysbetraveling
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for a night before an interview at UCSD. Arriving late at night, the room was not clearly marked on the outside, so a little searching was required. Once I found the room, it was basic with a king size bed, small table, and a desk. There was a fridge in the room which was nice. The towels smelled like smoke, but they appeared clean. The room overall was clean (which was not the case on many of the subsequent hotels I stayed at during this trip). Check-in and check-out was quick with no problems. I would stay at this motel again, but this is more of a place for budget minded customers and business.

Reviews.Title: “Get to hear your neigbors. Great for sociologists.”
Reviews.Author: livedin6countries
Reviews.Content: If you like to hear your what your nieghbors get up to, this is the place for you. On the bottom floors, you get to hear people get up walk to the bathroom and take a leak. Romance becomes a shared experience. If you want an audio only version of how the other people get on with their affairs, this may be the place for you. The staff is very nice, just the structure is a little old. The landscaping is great lots of flowers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to lay your head each night”
Reviews.Author: sunflower67
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took a vacation this April to San Diego. We were looking for a decent hotel for a good price. This was exactly it. The room was small but clean, and housekeeping did a great job keeping it that way. The paths to the front desk/pool/restaurant & bar were lush and nicely kept. Even though they were full, it was relatively quiet. Plenty of parking. No elevator to the second floor but that didn't bother us. Excellent location; easy access to major roads and attractions. Because we went to San Diego to tour and explore we were hardly ever at the hotel. So for a clean place to lay your head every night it was an excellent choice. I would stay at this location again. This is not a luxury hotel but it is not a dive either.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth price”
Reviews.Author: K_in_VA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before and after a cruise with 2 other couples. We found the rooms to be clean and adequate. The hotel was within walking distance to a trolley stop and a store. The pool area was beautiful. The restaurant served a good breakfast. and lunch. We found the staff to be very pleasant. We took taxis to the gaslamp district at night. It cost about $15.00 each way. We ate at Croce's. Loved it !!! Must try!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: broddles2
Reviews.Content: My daughter myself and family stayed here in Oct 2007 it is an older motel, the rooms were very small and we had to drag our luggage up the stairs, restaurant. was good as was the pool, we were not overly impressed by the front desk service. But we were only there for 4 days so we coped.

Reviews.Title: “felt like a cheap motel in Tijuana”
Reviews.Author: wizardHilo
Reviews.Content: we made our reservation 6 months in advance and still couldn't get adjoining rooms when we arrived. I even called that day early in the afternoon to request it. the staff and manager were very unsympathetic. they booked us upstairs 2 rooms apart, and this hotel has no elevators! we had to lug our bags up these unlevel stairs that had cracks in them and even my 8 yr old daughter could tell something was wrong and commented on how unsafe they felt. the walkway to our room was blocked by the air conditioning units that stuck out from every room into the walkway. each one also produced a trail of water that ran across the walkway. so we had to squeeze our suitcases past them and go through each little stream of water. arriving and leaving were just awful. the rooms were of average cleanliness but smaller than most places I've stayed. It felt tight. there wasn't enough floor space to open one suitcase on it. the front areas of the hotel are nice but the back section really feels like the second class section. the grading of the parking lot itself is uneven as if an amateur graded it. the ice machine is in an area in the center of the parking lot where the laundry facilities for the hotel are surrounded by an eyesore of a wooden fence. so to get ice you have to go outside across the parking lot! the overall feel of the place was a cheap Tijuana motel. I was embarassed to take my wife, children, and dad there.

Reviews.Title: “Free extras earn this an above average rating”
Reviews.Author: Celtress
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Best Western Seven Seas motel in San Diego for one night before our Mexican Riviera cruise, and for 2 nights afterwards through Hotels.com then called the motel directly to request a smoking room and was told no problem. It has a convienient location, right off the freeway on Hotel Circle, easy to get to, even with the horrid traffic. When we arrived at the room we noticed a no smoking sign, I called the front desk and was told there were no smoking rooms available even though I could see an entire building of non occupied smoking rooms just across the parking lot. I was also told that a fine of 75.00 would be imposed if we smoked in the room. A complaint call to Hotels.com resulted in a partial refund. The room itself was clean and comfortable, well laid out with ample lighting, clean bathroom and standard furniture: 2 chairs, small table, chest of drawers, a night stand or two and a bed. No complaints there, however no elevator meant having to lug our heavy suitcases up the outside stairs. The motel has a restaurant which we did not go to. It also has some nice greenery lined pathways that lead to a nice pool area with umbrella covered tables & chairs which made for a relaxing place to sit while we figured out how to use our new video camera. We signed up for the free shuttle to take us to the cruise ship terminal and the next morning the kindly driver assisted us with the luggage and off we went. After our cruise we were picked up by the motel's shuttle and we spent 2 more nights at motel before driving back home. This time they had opened the long building in the back (where the smoking rooms are) which made the stay nicer since we did not have to go outside to smoke as we did before. The second room we had was also clean and comfortable, it contained a desk and TV, one chair and table, 2 night stands and the bed. One wall was covered in mirror. There was an alcove/closet where suitcases could be stored and the bathroom was divided where the comode and tub was behind a door, separated from the sink. They had a coffee maker on the sink's counter with makings for coffee or tea, and I believe there was a tiny frige under the sink (could be wrong on that). The one thing that caused me to book the room was finding out they allow you to leave you car there during your cruise.... at no extra charge! Just leave your keys with them at the desk. We were off on the cruise for 8 nights and my car did not appear to be touched at all. All in all it was a good experience to stay at the Best Western Seven Seas in San Diego, even though we were unable to smoke in the room the first night. It was a good value for the money and I would certainly recommend this motel to anyone taking a cruise out of San Diego, especially if you are driving there and need a place to park the car while on the cruise. The staff was generally pleasant, although not very helpful the first night. The above average rating is for their allowing me to park my car there, and for the free shuttle to the cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and clean”
Reviews.Author: dukeswalker
Reviews.Content: We were going on a cruise on 1-1-08 out of San Diego and needed a place to stay for one night and park our cars for the time we were on the ship. We booked their park and stay package for $99/night. The rooms were small - but had a decent closet area to pile up our suitcases in for the one night we were there. You cna tell the property is old but they have done their best to work with what they have. I really felt like I should have been skeeved out by the place - it just had that feel to it - but, it was really, really clean - and served our purpose well. You needed to make reservations for the shuttle to take you to the port (wish we had been told this earlier) and we were able to secure the LAST spots on the shuttle that would get us there on time. The shuttle dropped you off right where we needed to be and picked us up within 10 minutes of getting off the boat. I would recommend staying at this property for one-two nights - but no more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Shanno497
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location the night before taking a cruise out of San Diego. They have newly remodeled rooms, friendly staff, onsite restaurant, and a free shuttle to take you to the pier. If you ask about the city tours the tram stops there and they can get you set up for one. They allowed us to park our car there without charge for about 5 nights, and take their shuttle back from our cruise to get our car afterwards. Located within easy driving distance of shopping and food.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in san diego.”
Reviews.Author: deelimerick
Reviews.Content: stayed in the bestwestern seven seas hotel san diego .from 18/12/07, to 5/1/08. was a bit worried with the reviews i had read about the hotel .but it was great , food in the hotel was a bit dear ,but was very good. staff were very friendly and the room very clean .would recommend it . yours truly mrs dolores brazil ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: sez_dee
Reviews.Content: I quite liked this hotel however i found that there wasnt very much around to do around the area. The room was clean but very dated. The grounds were kept perfect and i really enjoyed the pool area. The restarrant/cafe is also worth a visit, the food is great and the staff are so friendly (I recommend the southwest chicken burger - yum). The hotel provides a free shuttle service to Seaworld and the Zoo which i thought was great. The problem i had with the hotel was both days we were staying there we found numerous flyers for take away food under the door. When i ducked out to get a drink i saw people delivering them and i got the feeling that the security wasnt very high as i didnt appreciate non-guest just wandering around. If I visited San Diego again i dont think i would stay here unless i had a car.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PineappleTennessee
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed here for five days while visiting San Diego for pleasure for the first time. It was very adequate for us. The room was fine. It was small, but It served it's purpose since we would only be there to sleep. It was nice to have a small fridge to put our drinks in. The restaurant came in handy especially for breakfasts. As good as any breakfast you could find anywhere else. Had mid-afternoon lunch there a few days, and it was excellent. The staff in the restaurant were very friendly and efficient. Went to the hot tub several times. Nice surroundings. There was also a small workout room. Bar for cocktails. It had everything you could need. Grocery store nearby if you wanted to drive and pick up necessities. And there's also a mall within walking distance. The hotel provided transportation to the zoo, harbor, seaworld. That was a plus if you did not feel like driving. We would definitely stay there again. All the staff were very nice and accommodating. That counts for a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: NielsB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August, while visiting San Diego. It's not exactly located in the city, but by car you're in the Gaslamp quarter in less than 15 minutes. Sea World is about 15-20 minutes away, and the Fashion Valley mall is right around the corner. We'd found this hotel through checking and cross-checking between hotelsrus and tripadvisor. The price was pretty good, and the reviews were good as well. The hotel is located right off the I-8, along with a whole lot of other hotels. Unfortunately breakfast wasn't included in the price; you'll have to either bring your own and eat in your room, buy breakfast in the on-site restaurant, or somewhere else entirely. We didn't check out the restaurant, opting instead to try out restaurants in town, both for breakfast and dinner. About the hotel itself; the rooms are adequate, the decoration wasn't exactly to our tastes (one wall was a mirror), but fine otherwise. We had a King-size bed, which unfortunately sagged a bit in the middle, both sideways and front-back. Not the best bed we've ever had. My brother stayed in a different room, with 2 double beds, and according to him those beds also had the sagging problem. We tried out the pool, which was nice, albeit a bit on the small size. Towels could be found in the exercise room near the pool. All in all, a good hotel, decent prices, nice location. They should however do something about the beds. They're not horrible, but adding a central support or something would improve them, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: Matty33
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, we were in San Diego mainly to visit the zoo and Sea World. Ideal location for travelling to these, had a car and felt we needed one although there was a free hotel shuttle for use as and when day and night if booked in time. I was apprehensive before getting to the hotel as some of the comments on trip advisor are far from complimentary and seeing the motel like rooms ondriving in did'nt inspire me with confidence. After checking in and asking for a nice room, we were allocated one with 2 queen beds {4 of us}. 1st floor no 336. The room looked as if it had recently been refurbished, was big enough for us 4 and 5 cases and was spotlessly clean. Though the bathroom was small but was not a problem as the sink and units were in the bedroom. I was pleasantly suprised overall.The pool area was clean it had a small gym and pool towels to use. Very welcoming on an evening for the kids to jump in the pool {closed at 10pm} and us to have a drink from the poolside bar. There was free internet access in reception. We only used the hotel restaurant for breakfast and it was as good as anywhere. If i was in San Diego again I would have no second thoughts about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms very small”
Reviews.Author: LeedsTravel-Queen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days. It was on the Hotel Circle, where all the tourist hotels are. There is nothing on the road except hotels. You definitely need a car if you are staying here. The rooms were very small. The hotel has an outdoor launderette, which is good and also has an outdoor swimming pool. The reception staff weren't very helpfull as the hotel offers a free shuttle into downtown san diego, but no-one in the hotel told us this, we just spotted the bus! All the hotels have their own restaurant attached but s bit further down there is a shop where you can buy breakfast. I wouldn't stay here again if i came to San Diego, would try and stay near the Seaport village as this was lovely, and more central.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: HDMay21
Reviews.Content: My company booked this hotel for me as a single female traveler. My horrible experience began when I arrived at 10:30 PM to a completely dark room, which is of course very dangerous. The light switch inside the door did nothing, so I fumbled around until I found a low wattage lamp that was expected to light the entire main area of the room. The lamp flickered, and I discovered that the outlet to which it was plugged did not appear to be up to code - the plug would not stay in securely. My nightmare continued when I awoke at 2 AM to an infomercial playing in the room next to me loud enough that I could hear every word. I called the hotel staff, who spent the next 30 minutes pounding on the door and repeatedly calling the room's inhabitants. The TV was finally shut off, but in a few hours I woke to not my alarm clark, but all the alarms from the rooms around me (read - THIN WALLS). In addition, my room did not meet my expectations for cleanliness, which are admittedly high. The wireless access did not work. The breakfast advertised fresh eggs, but I was most certainly served powdered, not to mention the high price and terrible service. The staff spent the afternoon sawing something in the parking lot outside my room. On subsequent nights, I returned to multiple canine unit police cars parked outside the hotel in the driving lanes, not in spaces, which can only lead me to believe they were not there to enjoy the below-grade breakfast I mentioned previously. I did NOT feel safe in this hotel, and am questioning whether I will ever stay in a Best Western ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Place at the bottom of your list”
Reviews.Author: photous_passing_by
Reviews.Content: Nestled in the corner at the end of Hotel Circle sits a lovely landscaped large scale apartment style complex but inside it's true, the rooms are small giving you the feeling that you know you paid for more. The walls are so thin you could hear the shower running next door and when the next door closes (or was that two doors down) you could hear it and feel the aftershock. The bed sagged in the middle but not enough to give me a bad back. Most disappointing is no continental breakfast (restaurant on site). On the positive side, the staff was pleasant and helpful and the room was clean. There are dozens of other hotels on the block and it would be worth your while to check them out first. For the price and quietness, this was our worst Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: vportals
Reviews.Content: This Best Western is in a convenient location, probably no more than a 15-30 min drive to all of the major San Diego attractions (downtown, the zoo, Sea World, the beaches). As far as I could tell, all rooms have outside entrances. The area closer the pool (the front building) seemed newer than the other buildings, the landscaping there was beautiful. The middle building looked like it was being remodeled with new furniture and bathroom vanities, not sure how long that will be going on. Our room was in the back section. There was no street noise back there (the hotel is right next to/under I-8), but we had to deal with the noise from the coin-op laundry area outside of our room and the walls seemed pretty thin (both sources of noise quieted down not long after 11p). There is a pool and hot-tub outside near the front building; we didn't use either but they seemed nice when we walked by them. There's an on-site restaurant just off the lobby/check-in are where we ate breakfast. It was ok, nothing special. If you have a car I'd suggest getting breakfast somewhere else (Hillcrest has some nice options), but the food there is fine and edible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Fibbersfan
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel choice for the price. The grounds are kept nice and they were planting flowers while my child and I were there. Pool area is kept up nice and is large/heated. Restaurant/bar borders the pool area. I needed a one night stay because the first night of our trip was not available at my hotel of choice. Wish I had stayed here all three nights. I was reluctant to stay here because it was a drive up to your room hotel....which I do not prefer. It was fine. My child liked the pool area. Room area was clean. Staff were nice. Price was fair. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Best Western, but tough beds”
Reviews.Author: Kosmo63
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days at the end of Feb 2007. The local on Hotel Circle is great â€“ very convenient to Mission Bay and Mission, Ocean, and Pacific Beaches, to Old Town, to Balboa Park, and to downtown. The heated pool and 2 hottubs were nice. There is a little workout room (not mentioned by Best Western listing, it seems), with extra towels for the pool. Plenty of vending machines. Rooms at the east side of each of the 3 buildings are near the 163 freeway; you can hear traffic noise unless you run the heater/AC. Rooms near the jungle walkway through the property (i.e., lots of plants, very nice) had more â€œtropicalâ€� location; ours was far from this and seemed more like a standard motel room. The room was clean. The TV had many cable channels though some hotels have more (e.g., no A&E, HGTV, or History) and no movie channels, only pay Movies on Demand. The major problem was that the beds were very firm and somewhat sagging toward the middle. Nice place, but uncomfortable sleeping. There was a single computer in the lobby for guest use for the internet; donâ€™t know whether there was wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Town and Country”
Reviews.Author: cmjones
Reviews.Content: The Seven Seas is not fantastic but a great value. I've stayed there 3 times and has always been adequate. Grounds are nice and it is a close walk under the freeway to the Town and Country Hotel and Convention Center, where you will pay nearly double for a similar room. When I was a student going to a conference it was a good way to save money. Now that someone else pays the bills I still stay at the Seven Seas

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazymon
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon in San Diego and choose Best Western Seven Seas. Staff was very friendly and made us feel like family during our week getaway. Hotel has a nice shuttle service if you can figure out when it runs... very close to Sea World which made for a good time as well. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SWCalgaryGuy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Best Western Seven Seas while on a stopover in San Diego on our way to Cabo San Lucas. While it's not a very fancy hotel, it did provide free airport shuttle service (the airport wasn't far at all), and we had just a short stroll to the trolley (which we took to see a Chargers football game), as well as the Fashion Valley Mall, which has some amazing shopping. I would stay at this hotel again. Very friendly staff and extremely convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: heegmond
Reviews.Content: Very friendly people and a good restaurant. The room is just what you expect from a best western.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Motel”
Reviews.Author: Nasha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in September. This was the next place we stayed at after Disney hotel...... the size of the room came as a bit of a shock! The smallest one so far!! It was very clean and tidy. A little bit of a squash as we needed to get our toddlers cot into the room too. He kind of had to be half pushed into the cupboard to allow us to get into the bathroom!!! The location of the motel was superb. Our room was on the ground floor away from the Freeway. Were heard no noise from other guests or traffic. The restaurant on site was brilliant, very reasonable and good food. The fashion mall is a very short drive. You must visit the factory outlets on the i5.. they are the last exit before the Mexicn border. There is Nike, Reebok, Puma, Converse, Gap and many more!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - shame about the room size”
Reviews.Author: Starman99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 7 nights 16-23 September 2006 in building 3 on the ground floor. Stayed in 3 hotels during this trip to California and the room was the smallest by far! Goods points - we don't drive so access to attractions and public transport was paramount. BW7 is within 10 minutes walk of bus/ trolley interchange. Hotel provided free shuttle to Seaworld, Zoo and airport/Amtrak/Greyhound. On site restaurant was superb. Staff helpful and courteous. Room although small was clean and presenatble. Pool was of a decent size if a little cool! Bad Points - Room size! Overall - would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does not care about its guests”
Reviews.Author: HUSKERTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: I would like to begin by saying that my search to find an affordable, family oriented, and convenient hotel in San Diego left me thoroughly exhausted! I had originally hoped to stay on the bay or ocean, but the astronomical prices wanted by those hotels was out of the question. The Seven Seas advertised a pretty, tropical setting which at least gave you the illusion of being at the beach. While it was nicely landscaped with palm trees it was not as nice as advertised. I usually make reservations online, however, the hotel website would only allow you to reserve rooms with 2 doubles. All the reviews stated that the rooms were small so we wanted to reserve a suite since we were traveling with 3 young children. Therefore, we had to call the propertly directly to reserve a suite. We were told that they had 1 Master Suite with a patio, and 2 JR. Suites. They said the suites were issued 1st come, 1st served so that would only guarantee that we would get some sort of suite, not the Master. Well excuse me, but if we are making advance reservations, why can't we reserve it? We asked for an AARP discount and they told us the suites were not discounted, only the regular rooms. I later tried to check our reservation on the Best Western website and couldn't find it. So I called back the hotel and they confirmed that we did have a reservation. I asked if they could mail me a written confirmation since I couldn't print one off the internet. They said NO. I was not happy, but was so thoroughly spent looking for a hotel in San Diego that I just let it go. I could not relax wondering if I was going to have a reservation when I got there or not. We decided to call a few hours before our arrival to make sure everything was OK. We asked if the Master Suite was available. We were told that we could have it. When we arrived we were told that it had been given to someone else. REAL NICE! The Jr. Suite was basically 2 adjoining rooms, so at least we had plenty of space for our family. We had 2 bathrooms and 2 large closets so we could get all of our luggage out of the way. The kids had to sleep on a Queen sleeper sofa, but they were small enough that it worked. If there are more than 2 people in your party you will have to have a suite!! At least we had 2 TV's, however, the kids weren't entertained very well as they didn't have the Cartoon channel or Disney. Most of the channels were news or in Spanish. The good thing about our suite was that it was back against the hillside and therefore quiet, no freeway noise. It was a bit of a hike to the pool or restaurant. Room service was fast and had good food. The prices were very steep! One night I ordered a $2 side salad and they brought me a massive $10 chef salad. I sent it back as I was not about to pay for it. We did not see any restaurants between the hotel and main tourist attractions so you really didn't have much choice but to eat there. You can't save money by cooking your own food because there aren't any microwaves. The maid would place our room service dishes outside the door and they would sit there for several days before being picked up. We were rather offended by the poolside cocktail party and BBQ for government employees only. If you're going to have a private party it should be held in a private location, not a public one where everyone else is staring at you and feeling left out! Another disappointment was the shuttle system. What a joke! They advertise shuttle service to major attractions. Well when you get there they give you a sheet telling you the shuttle is basically for airport passengers. They will take you to Sea World at 9:30 AM and pick you up at 4:30, hardly enough time to see everything. Then if someone needs airport service you will just have to wait. We were on an extended trip and needed to use the laundry facilities. GOOD LUCK! They had 4 sets of washers and dryers and they were ALWAYS full, no matter what time of day or night it was. The waiting area was usually full of unsavory looking people which made you feel uneasy. Every evening after sightseeing we returned to the hotel to find several police cars in front of the hotel or at the hotel next door. That made us very uncomfortable! We never did hear what the problem was. The grounds were somewhat pretty, but not near as nice as the internet photos. Overall, it was very disappointing!! It would have been much nicer if we could have had a patio to sit outside on. This was the cheapest place we could find in San Diego, but for the price we paid we could have gone to the Caribbean and had real luxury and service. Now that we have seen San Diego we can say that it is somewhere that we do not care to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: MeccaN
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that this hotel is a very nice place to stay---and it is especially nice if your traveling with the kids!! The food was decent and the surroundings were beautiful. I missed my shuttle to the bus station to go to LA and the hotel paid for a cab to the bus station for me!! I highly recommend this hotel to stay at with the family. Tashi from Philadelphia

Reviews.Title: “aahhh it was OK”
Reviews.Author: Oceanview Please
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 days, Checked in Monday the NON SMOKING room we we're given stank, the front desk was almost no help stating they would send up housekeeping to "spray" some air freshener... it stank of smoke and mildew, I asked for a refund and was greeted with an "you'll have to take that up with Hotel, COM attitude. Finally got in touch with the night desk manager Steve and insisted he come smell the room. The word he gave it" Pretty Narley" and gave us another room I feel sorry for whom ever got that one, as they stated they were completely booked. I also believe from the attitude there is some prejudice against those who book outside of Best Western proper. The rooms are small but the beds were comfortable and if not for Steve the night manager changing our room at the last minute the stay would have been intolerable. We paid 97.00 per night and felt it was overpriced. Told you Steve you never know who writes reviews....

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidGrayFans
Reviews.Content: Read previous customer reviews, saw photos of property seemed decent, needed a place to stay overnight since our other hotel couldn't add another night, late arrival. Property supposedly had been renovated, where ??? Stayed here Aug. 10, 2006 our room was on the 1st floor by pool. Room was old. air freshner coming from somewhere smelled like mens cologne, mold on walls were the ratty iron & ironing board was stored, shower head had pressure alright, like a fire hydrant. Got in a little earlier than expected had fun going to Old Town for dinner but couldn't wait to check out. Would never recommend it...........Stay at the Hampton Downtown San Diego instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and good value”
Reviews.Author: alohabeach
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my young daughter for a short last minute trip to sunny San Diego. Our destinations were the Zoo and Sea World. As our time was limited, I did not want to hassle with a rental car, so we looked into hotels with shuttles to / from airport and nearby places. We were lucky to find accomodations at the Seven Seas the day before arrival. The drivers were all so friendly and we could not have visited the parks without this service. Plus it is in walking distance to the Fashion Valley Mall and the Red Transit line. So we could easily get around without a car for 4 days. The property itself is beautifully landscaped with tropical plants and our location on the property was free of noise and traffic. There is a nice, reasonable cafe with full menu and room service on site and it serves up a quick breakfast croissant to go. The staff at the cafe are also nice and accomodating to your needs. The pool was just the right size and only seemed crowded for a short period of time. One morning it did not feel heated, but it was a hot week so perhaps the sun warmed it up by the afternoon. The room could use a furniture makeover, new mattress, bedding, quieter a/c unit and brighter carpets. But it was clean and for the short amount of time spent in our room, we could hardly complain. I would definitely consider this property again, if our transportation situation was the same. Otherwise, I'd like to check out some beach locations next time.

Reviews.Title: “nice property”
Reviews.Author: btworld
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this propery over the July 4th holiday. When we first arrived we were placed in an extremely small room with two double beds. After the first night we requested two queens and were given an interior room that was huge. We had a refrigerator and coffe maker plus a view of the garden area. When you book your room ask for an interior room with two queen beds. Everything was very clean and the staff was extremely helpful. The location was convenient to all attractions and the beach. The rate was very good for San Diego during a holiday week. Be sure to check other booking sites like expedia and travelocity because best western will match their rates. Overall this hotel was good and we would stay there again if we were traveling with our kids or on a budget. Also, there is a great restaurant in the hillcrest area called the "hash house a go go". Don't be put off by the name it was amazing. We had breakfast there and the pancakes were as big as platters. The food was delicous and reasonalbly priced. Don't miss this place for some great food and fun.

Reviews.Title: “a good room for the price”
Reviews.Author: quicktrip27
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the seven seas and overall it was a good hotel. The room was clean but small. Since we only had 4 days in San Diego we didn't spend much time in the hotel but we did get to the pool on the last morning and wished we had used it before then. The landscaping was beautiful. We ate at the cafe or the Pam Pam diner next door for breakfast both were fine. So for $99 a night it was fine.
